dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saturn swims against the stars, its rings slicing the nig DIONE, a pale moon, looms in the foreground.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: A battleship crosses the moon’s disk. On its hull: the na HIGHLINE - and the symbol of a red hawk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN CONRAD VANCE of the Offworld Marine Corps prepare for combat. He is a rugged man of 40, calm and focused. I his massive ARMORED SPACE SUIT he looks superhuman: a hal ton war machine. His rifle is big as a cannon. Technicians swarm around him, checking systems. Nearby, more technicians tend to ELEVEN OTHER MARINES: el soldiers in their late 20s and early 30s. Vance is first on his feet. He steps free of his prep sta and walks the line, inspecting his men. Motors hum as he walks. His footfalls shake the deck. One of Vance's men catches his eye - MOX, a seasoned sold

dialogues.speaker: MOX
dialogues.text: What do you think, Cap? Vance shrugs - a massive movement of armored shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: The ammo load is armor-piercing, so whatever we're fighting, it's big.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That's right. Silence in the room. The Marines turn to the man who stan on a raised deck above them: their commander, COLONEL COB Coburn wears an ordinary uniform and a headset. He frowns concentration, listening and talking at once.

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: The Hegemony has heavy tanks advancing on the Dione Colony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colony has anti-ship guns. How did they land tanks?

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: They dropped 'em weeks ago on the far side of the moon. They crawled all the way around, right under the radar.

dialogues.speaker: MOX
dialogues.text: What crawled all the way around?

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: Four D-Class tanks. And a mystery target. Something bigger.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Bigger than a D-Class?

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: Something new. Target's designated “Colossus”. We've got destroyers inbound, but they’re six hours away. Right now you’re all we have. The Marines become grim. This is a desperate action.

dialogues.speaker: COBURN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Six thousand people live and work in the Dalton Mining Colony. Maybe they’1l be rotting in prison ships tonight. Maybe they'll be free. You decide it now. Lock in. The Marines step into metal drop capsules. The capsules c and sink into their launch tubes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DIONE COLONY, an industrial city, sits rooted to the rock. The red hawk symbol is painted on its walls. Around the city, the mines lie silent: digging machines abandoned in their trenches. MISSILES swarm over the horizon toward the colony. The colony’s GUNS blast some from the sky. Other missiles detonate against the city walls. A digging machine EXPLODES in a weird airless fireball. Smoke clears. Across the valley, four D-CLASS TANKS clim over the ridgeline. They are three stories high, painted the blue interlocking circles of the Hegemony. The colony goes turtle: withdrawing its towers, it closes and hunkers down against the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Battleship's guns begin to fire in a cycle of terribl violence: pounding at their targets on the moon below. Twelve DROP-CAPSULES launch. Rocket toward the surface of Dione.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battleship’s bombardment hammers the tanks. Near-miss and hits. Their armor is damaged but withstands the assau The tanks launch flares and interceptor missiles. A drop-capsule rockets down and shatters, revealing Vance full armor. He vaults from the impact crater - as a missi explodes where he just landed. Other drop capsules hurtle down, OTHER MARINES emerge. Th take cover in rocky terrain chaotic with explosions. ATHENA’S VOICE All troops down safe.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Marines! Give me a battle line, twenty meter spacing. Athena. Tactical. The electronic voice of his armor's battle computer answe him - feminine, calming. ATHENA’S VOICE Tactical. Vance’s visor lights up, painting the terrain around him data: enemies, friendlies, ranges and velocities. Each Marine is tagged in Vance's display with his name an status. Vance watches his men move into a battle line. ATHENA’S VOICE Four D-Class tanks incoming. Target “Colossus” out of range.  The four tanks loom closer. Behind them, Vance’s visor display indicates the Colossus, hidden behind the ridge.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Advance on me. Fire as you go. Vance moves toward the D-Class Tank at a run through the broken terrain. The other Marines join in seconds later, their rifles blazing. ATHENA’S VOICE Incoming fire. From the tanks, energy beams flash toward the Marines. Va cartwheels off the ground, JUMP-JETS flaring from his boo He arcs through space, firing all the while. Behind him Marines take evasive action on their jets.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: We're not breaching the armor. Let's get close and do some demolition. ATHENA’S VOICE Fatality. Sergeant Holder. Vance charges a tank. Enemy fire rakes the ground around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onscreen, Colonel Coburn watches the battle unfold below. A fatality marker throbs where Sergeant Holder fell. The eleven remaining Marines charge toward the enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance reaches a tank: gets in under its guns and keeps go right between its gnashing treads and under its armored b From a pod on his thigh he pulls a series of powerful min Plants them on the belly of the tank.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Athena. Detonate on my mark. On the underside of the tank, belly hatches open. ARMED TROOPERS drop out. Their gunfire ricochets off his armor. Vance hurls a mine into an open hatch. Fires his jump-jet Cannonballs through the troopers into the clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! Behind him the tank EXPLODES spectacularly. Vance scans the battlefield - two of the D-Class Tanks bu furiously. Marines concentrate fire on the other two. ATHENA’S VOICE Fatality. Lieutenant Carver. Vance looks up, and gapes in awe. The COLOSSUS climbs ove the ridge: a tank twice as big as the D-Class machines. A fortress on the move.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I see the Colossus. It’s a monster.

dialogues.speaker: COBURN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We are hitting it now. A barrage of shells from the orbiting Battleship. Explosi march across the lunar surface and pound the Colossus. When the smoke clears, the Colossus is battered but intac still coming. Its mammoth guns rise to point toward the stars.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Heads up, Command! Colossus is returning fire... A thunderous concussion shakes the ground. Flames leap as Tank's heavy guns all fire at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunfire from the Colossus far below tears into the Battleship, triggering a chain of EXPLOSIONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Coburn, shaken badly, watches damage reports stre in from the Battleship’s burning sections.

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: Marines. We are hit. Highline is disengaging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Battleship veers away from Dione.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All four of the D-Class Tanks are burning hulks. Marines emerge from the smoking wreckage to advance on the Coloss Vance watches in horror as the mighty guns of the Colossu lower to engage in the surface battle.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Rapid advance! Move! Move! The battle line breaks into a run: the Marines sprint tow the Colossus, rifles flashing... The HEAVY GUNS of the Colossus open fire. The Marines tak evasive action - but one by one soldiers are BLASTED into oblivion. ATHENA’S VOICE Fatality. Sergeant Markhart. Fatality. Sergeant Chan. Casualty. Lieutenant Drake. Vance roars in rage.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Cover! Take cover! The Marines dive for shelter as the guns shake the earth.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Too many. Too many. He stares at the Colossus, scanning the giant war machine with telescopic vision. His gaze settles on the anti-personnel gun turrets that protrude like steel barrels from the tank's hull.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: McGrath! Get to Drake. Run a med- check. Everybody else, fire from cover on my order. Target the sensors. Eyes and ears. I want that monster blind. Ready... (gathers himself, poised to sprint) Fire! Vance explodes from cover, racing toward the Colossus. A him, the Marines blast away at the Colossus's sensors wit precision rifle fire. Vance is half running and half flying, his jump-jets blaz The Colossus pounds the battlefield with haphazard firepo but Vance weaves and leaps and the gunfire doesn’t touch He gets in past the guns. Leaps onto the Colossus. Clings magnetically beside a gun turret. A plasma torch extends from his forearm. He aims at the s where the turret meets the hull and lights up. Blinding light from the contact point. His visor darkens. White-hot liquid metal gouts down the side of the tank. He plants his feet, wraps his arms around the gun and hea The motors of his battle-suit WHINE. ATHENA’S VOICE Warning. Critical strain.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (through clenched teeth) Override! With a SCREECH, the entire turret tears out of the tank. GUNNER spins to the rock below. A BLAST of escaping air. Vance swings into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance bulls down a passageway. He barely fits. The should of his armored suit scrape the walls. His visor’s heads-up display streams with data as ATHENA the inside of the tank.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Hold your fire. I’m inside the Colossus.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Inside?! A TANK CREWMAN rakes Vance with bullets that bounce off h armor. Vance blows him away with a single shot. Vance reaches a ladder-well leading upward. He starts up and his shoulders CLANG against the well rim. He doesn’t Vance heaves. The ladder rungs bend under his hands. Wit shriek of metal, the walls of the ladder-well give way.

dialogues.speaker: COLOSSUS
dialogues.text: The COMMAND CREW does damage control: drivers wrestle wit controls...gunnery officers search for targets. They wear light vacuum suits. Behind them, the ladder-well emerges from the deck plates A ROAR. The bridge is shaken by an unseen force. Vance BLASTS out of the ladder-well on his jets, SMASHES the ceiling. Lands on his feet in a shower of scrap metal The deck crew spins in alarm. Two crewmen pull pistols an fire. Bullets ricochet wildly. Vance’s rifle comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An explosion blows out the Colossus’s command bridge. Jet flame billow into space. The Colossus goes dark. Churns to a stop. A hailstorm of shrapnel pelts the battlefield. Vance lands on his feet in the dust - armor dark with soo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marines gather again in their ready room. They are transformed: armor pitted and blackened, faces smeared wi sweat and blood. Only seven men remain. Technicians lift their helmets off, open up their armor. men are wounded: medics rush to help them. The Marines gather around Vance, slap his shoulders in gr celebration: they are mindful of their losses.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: This was all you, Cap.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: This was the fighting two-ten, best platoon in the Corps.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: But the big kill was yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kill belongs to the men we lost. When we get inside the Colony, we drink to them.

dialogues.speaker: COBURN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We won't be seeing the inside of Dione Colony. The men turn. Coburn stands above them on his command dec

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: We lift as soon as our casualties are aboard. The Marines murmur in protest.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Back to Mars already?

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: Earth. Special orders. Sudden silence.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: What’s it about, sir?

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: I don't know. Captain Vance has been called home. We’re just along for the ride. The men’s eyes turn to Vance in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: (to all the men) I wish I could grant you some shore leave. You've earned it. But I have orders. (points at Vance) You. In my stateroom. INT. BATTLESHIP HIGHLINE (IN FLIGHT) - COBURN’S STATEROOM A luxurious cabin by spacefaring standards but still cram Colonel Coburn sits reading an electronic slate. The engines rumble. Saturn’s rings slide past the porthol Vance enters in regular uniform, hair damp. He looks wary  10.

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: Vance, you've done more combat tours than any man in the division. I've done all I can to keep you where you want to be. But it looks like I'm losing you. (reads slate) “Transport Captain Conrad Vance to Earth ASAP. Run silent. Avoid hazard of combat. Vance to report on arrival to the State Science Agency for special duty.” Vance looks stunned. This makes no sense to him.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: The SSA?

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: What it says. A battleship diverted to take one man home!

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What does the Science Agency want with a Marine? Do they run combat ops?

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: Who knows what they do? But the Secretary of Defense signed the order himself. It’s for real.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I'm a soldier, not a lab rat. I'd like to protest the order.

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: Not under radio silence. Two weeks to Earth. Nothing to do ‘til then but rest up. Your orders. (he hands Vance the slate) Maybe it's time you got out of the field. You ought to have my job by now. Hell, you ought to be senior to me. How long can you keep refusing promotions?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'll stay in armor as long as they let me. (he laughs) Maybe that's what the Science guys want. To have my head examined.  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance and the other Marines lie in their bunks watching v on electronic slates as light as magazines. One soldier d off in front of a news broadcast:

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: The Allied States and the Hegemony broke off arms-control talks after weeks of deadlock. Stockpiles of fusion and gravity weapons continue to grow. Another soldier munches bright blue chips from a bag and watches a different channel:

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Prices rose again as the population outgrew the food supply for the sixth year running... And a third soldier watches a video letter from home.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE'S WIFE
dialogues.text: ...somebody tapped into the Baxters' water pipes! At these prices I guess you can't be surprised. But imagine, stealing water! Vance watches a broadcast with particular interest:

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: +..-more than half of the federal budget is now classified. Despite popular outcry against this secret spending, the so-called "black funds" continue to grow. Five bunks are empty. Folded flags commemorate the dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scarred Battleship passes an Allied States defensive space station: a huge manned satellite bristling with gun The satellite SCANS the Battleship with a laser beam as i passes. Earth shines below, half in light and half in shadow. On planet's night side, cities shine in the darkness: far la than today's cities, and connected by arteries of light.  12. The Battleship descends toward the eastern seaboard of No America - where dawn is fast approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast landing ground surrounds the spaceport terminal. Military spacecraft lie at harbor. The distant towers of Washington shine in the sunrise. The Battleship Highline settles into a landing bay. A gan tube extends from the spaceport to the battleship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance debarks alone, in dress uniform: his chest crowded medals. Walks the long transparent tube toward the termin His men watch him go, dressed in common fatigues.

dialogues.speaker: SPACEPORT TERMINAL
dialogues.text: Vance emerges from the gangway into a busy concourse. An officer in a military uniform stands waiting: JOHN RANDALL, 50, a good-natured bear of a man with a barrel c and a crew cut.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Captain Vance. (they exchange salutes, shake hands) Major John Randall. Department of Defense. Welcome home.

dialogues.speaker: SPACEPORT CONCOURSE
dialogues.text: Vance and Randall walk together.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: It's an honor to meet you, Captain. I know what you did on Dione. He shakes his head, speechless. Vance nods his thanks.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: I'm here to make the handoff to your new command.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Who’s my C.O. now?  13. Randall's forehead wrinkles in perplexity.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: The lawyers are looking at that. The whole arrangement's unusual. Technically, it looks like your c.0O. is Jarod Marbeck. Director of the State Science Agency.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (amazed) The Director of the SSA. And what does he want with me?

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Secretary of Defense signed your orders. He didn’t tell me why.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Speak of the devil. He nods over Randall’s shoulder at...

dialogues.speaker: A PUBLIC MEDIA TERMINAL
dialogues.text: The news. A pretty ANCHORWOMAN speaks. In an inset image, SECRETARY OF DEFENSE gives a press conference.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORWOMAN, (ONSCREEN)
dialogues.text: Secretary of Defense Gideon Dain today announced the end of hostilities over the Dalton Colony on Dione. The image cuts to the press conference. DEFENSE SECRETARY GIDEON DAIN speaks: a chiseled man with salt-and-pepper h and the brick-solid build of a career soldier.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY DAIN, (ONSCREEN)
dialogues.text: Today the Hegemony surrendered its claim to our mining colonies on Dione, after last month’s defensive action by the Offworld Marines. Vance grins in satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY DAIN, (ONSCREEN)
dialogues.text: The action was exemplary. Our losses, acceptable... Vance’s smile fades.  14.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY DAIN, (ONSCREEN)
dialogues.text: ...and the Dalton Colonists remain free people. The news cuts to a piece on overpopulation.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Nobody minds losing some soldiers, as long we win. I was in the Offworld Corps myself. Seventeenth Division, Mercury terminator. (Randall hikes up his trouser leg. His right leg is a high-tech prosthetic.) Then I tangled with a neutron gun and landed me a desk job. Vance gives the artificial leg an expert glance.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: That's a good leg. I have friends with that leg.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY BARRIERS
dialogues.text: Vance and Randall exit the spaceport’s secure zone throug humming gauntlet of sensors and scanning beams. Beyond the barriers, a SCIENTIST waits: Vance’s age, athletically built. He wears a long black coat, styled li lab coat, and a black skullcap. His face shows no feeling

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: You must be...

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: Rune Banneker, Scientist.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (extending a hand) Captain Conrad Vance.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: (ignoring the hand) Yes. Come with me. Banneker turns to leave. Randall scowls in indignation.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: That's a war hero you're talking to. You take care of our man. Banneker replies with a supercilious smile.  15.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: He’s our man now. The Scientists strides off. Vance shoots a troubled look Randall, and hurries after the Scientist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance and Banneker soar into New Washington. They are alo the limousine pilots itself. New Washington is shining and beautiful: an architectural homage to the 20th-Century American city. Everywhere, signs of militarization: Soldiers on street corners. Propaganda posters. On billboards, military styl evident in civilian fashions. The red hawk banner of the Allied States flies from every building.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I haven't been here in years. It’s beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: City population is forty-six million. Growth rate is five percent plus a year. It's unsustainable. Vance stares at Banneker in distaste.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I’ve been off-world for two years. It’s beautiful. The limousine settles in front of an imposing classical skyscraper: The headquarters of the State Science Agency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cavernous lobby bustles with people. They wear styliz lab coats in white, gray, or black. The youngest wear whi coats, the oldest black. Heavily armed Agency Guards stand post at every door. Banneker strides through the vast front doors, Vance in t

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Welcome to the State Science Agency. Vance looks like he’s just stepped through the looking gl  16. Banneker heads for a distant bank of elevators. As they approach, he stares at an elevator: it opens.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: The doors close. Vance and Banneker are alone. Banneker gazes intently at the elevator’s control panel. Lights flash to life, and the elevator descends. The floor indicator reaches the lowest basement level - b the elevator KEEPS SINKING.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: We're still descending.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Yes. Vance stares. Banneker ignores him. The elevator plummets deep underground. After an endless time the elevator sighs to a halt. The d don’t open. Banneker hands Vance an electronic slate.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Before entering this facility, you must sign this writ of secrecy. Frowning, Vance scrolls through the dense legalese.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: "Penalties for violation of secrecy may include revocation of citizenship, imprisonment, or execution." Execution?

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: You can easily avoid the penalties by obeying the writ. The men stare at each other. Finally Vance presses his thumbprint in the signature box. Banneker takes the slate The elevator doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance and Banneker emerge into a bright vestibule. A cann on the ceiling rotates and aims its muzzle at Vance. Vance takes an experimental sidestep; the cannon ignores Banneker and tracks Vance like a hunting dog.  17.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Security’s tight down here.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERGROUND CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Banneker and Vance walk abreast at a brisk clip.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Why do you think we selected you, out of a hundred thousand Marines? A Scientist in a grey coat walks by, shepherding a myster mechanism on a motorized cart. Vance watches it pass.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Selected me for what?

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: We'll get to that. Why you?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I’ve seen more action than most.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: You've survived more missions than any trooper in the Offworld Corps. They pass another security cannon. Vance watches the weap unhappily as it tracks him.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I’ve been lucky.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: You have the fastest reflexes in the Corps, and the lowest resting pulse rate. Your eyesight and hearing are in the first percentile. You’re an amazing specimen. But that’s all trivia. The point is, you're the man who comes home.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: So far.

dialogues.speaker: GRAND CONCOURSE
dialogues.text: A huge subterranean space, gleaming and supermodern. Walk above walkways, all bustling with movement as Scientists hurry to and fro. In the center of the Concourse stands a great GLOBE OF EA it shows the world divided into two super-nations that co  18. every speck of land on the planet - the Allied States mar in red, the Hegemony in blue. Beside the globe stands JAROD MARBECK, 65, DIRECTOR OF TH STATE SCIENCE AGENCY. Magisterial and severe in an ornate black coat and cap.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Welcome, Captain. I'm Jarod Marbeck, Director of the State Science Agency. (he smiles) You're wondering why you're here.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Marbeck points at the globe turning slowly above them.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: We've lived in a state of cold war for more than a century. All our lives. Do you know how many times we've come close to total war?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Six. Six times we've armed our doomsday weapons and teetered on the brink of extinction. Imagine that! Marbeck shakes his head with the air of a man personally offended.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: We Scientists work to protect humanity. From disease. Famine. Cosmic accidents of every kind. This Agency has quietly rescued humanity more times than I can count. And for what? So our idiot politicians and military barbarians can march us right back to the abyss! The world's in danger. Our only home.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: We have colonies on the outer planets.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Little steel bubbles filled with air! If Earth is lost, they'll (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIRECTOR MARBECK (cont'd) perish in a year or two. No, I saw the truth long ago. There's only one way to safeguard our future.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: We need another world.

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNING COUNCIL CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Marbeck and Banneker lead Vance into an immaculate white conference room. Around the table: SCIENTIST WALTER LARSON, 60, slender an folksy; SCIENTIST MARTIN CAUL, 70, a bearded man with fie eyes; and SCIENTIST CORDELIA RHAY, 65, keen and severe. All the Scientists wear black coats and skullcaps. Behind each Scientist stands a gray-coated Apprentice. Vance's eyes are drawn to Martin Caul's Apprentice: ADA KILDARE, 30, a beauty whose hair falls to her shoulders. watches Vance with open curiosity. Marbeck and Banneker sit, leaving a chair at the foot of table. After an awkward moment Vance takes the empty chai

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Colleagues, this is Captain Conrad Vance of the Offworld Marine Corps. The Scientists inspect him. Vance looks back, his eyes lingering boldly on Ada. Flustered, she looks away. Marbeck points at Vance.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: I was your age when I became Director. You see, I was a prodigy too: but where you excel at killing, I had other talents. I enlarged the Astronomy division and began a search of the heavens. And in just five years I found what I was looking for. He raises his hand, and a STAR swells into existence in t air above the conference table - which is also a holograp generator. Vance is startled, which amuses the Scientists

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Erix. Similar in size and orbit to our own world, with a single large (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIRECTOR MARBECK (cont'd) moon. A new hope for humanity, just twenty light-years away. IN HOLOGRAM: Planets spring into being around the star. T fourth planet, ERIX, grows to fill the space over the tab an angry red planet with a pale yellow moon.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: I assembled the best scientific minds in the Agency. And they designed and built the most extraordinary spacecraft ever made. IN HOLOGRAM: The scene shifts. A spaceport orbits Jupiter Cradled in its scaffold is a saucer-shaped spacecraft. As the view shifts, the ship’s immensity becomes apparent Construction ships swarm over it like ants.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Prometheus!

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (awed) Nothing’s that big. The elderly Scientist Larson grins.

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: Prometheus is. Half a kilometer across, with a mass of seventy million tons. And history's biggest gravity drive running through its core. It’s a magnificent monster. Marbeck indulges Larson with a smile of real affection.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: And the greatest secret ever kept.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: How many people aboard?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: None. The Prometheus has no passenger compartments, no cockpit. It's a super-intelligent machine designed to transform Erix into a new Earth.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: A terraforming ship.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Yes! The Prometheus Project. This is Scientist Walter Larson, Chief (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIRECTOR MARBECK (cont'd) Engineer. He designed Prometheus forty years ago. Vance looks at Larson in surprise. Marbeck gestures at th other Scientists around the table.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Scientist Cordelia Rhay, Chief Physicist. Scientist Martin Caul, Chief Planetologist. You've met Scientist Banneker, Project Coordinator. I lead the project. And our work has begun in earnest. After a thirty year voyage, Prometheus has arrived. IN HOLOGRAM: Prometheus orbits Erix. It releases a shower probes that fall onto the planet: a swarm of satellites t swing into crisscrossing orbits. Prometheus lands and DIVIDES elaborately. Six sections cr away on giant treads, each a titanic machine in its own right. The core remains, a spire reaching into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: The ship’s core forms the Prometheus Ground Station, here. Six crawlers spread over the surface, sowing the seeds of new life. And now to the point. One of these crawlers has broken down. (he points) Crawler Three. Its communications array has failed. Without satellite data it can no longer chart its course. It will not move or launch the rockets it carries.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: How can you know this? It’s impossible to know what’s happening twenty light-years away. Any message would take twenty years to get here.

dialogues.speaker: RHAY
dialogues.text: That’s true - in the physics you were taught. But there have been some unannounced breakthroughs in the field. The Prometheus is connected to Earth by a device called a Lang Transporter. It allows objects to “travel” instantaneously from one point to another. The Prometheus has been (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RHAY (cont'd) sending us progress reports roughly once a week.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: You have a teleportation machine.

dialogues.speaker: RHAY
dialogues.text: A Lang Transporter. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: A transporter, Captain Vance, that works in both directions. A device large enough to transport a man. Vance digests this information. The Scientists watch him.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: You want me to go to Erix.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: You want me to repair Crawler Three. Marbeck smiles like a teacher pleased with a clever stude

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Marbeck leads Vance and the other Scientist along at a br clip. Security cannons continue to pick Vance out of the crowd and track him as he passes. Vance, shell-shocked by all he's learned, is trying to ge his head around it.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I thought I was pretty well- informed. You know, I read the news. Marbeck chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: The events that truly shape the world rarely make the news. Especially in this day and age.

dialogues.speaker: PROMETHEUS PROJECT
dialogues.text: A cavern of staggering dimensions, its floor lost in shad far below. A futuristic reactor looms in the darkness. At center of its coils: a chamber not much bigger than a cof  23. A catwalk stretches across empty space to the chamber. Marbeck leads Vance out onto the bridge. His voice echoes

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: The Lang Transporter. The only device of its kind. Humanity’s greatest invention, if humanity only knew it. That doorway there, that chamber...a gateway to another world. You will be the first to pass through, Captain. The first.

dialogues.speaker: PROMETHEUS PROJECT
dialogues.text: A huge industrial space connected to the Transport Facili Heavy machines hulk in the corners. Massive cranes hang overhead. The floor is a mosaic of conveyor belts and mov platforms. Banneker leads Vance in.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: We have everything you should need. If we don’t have it, we can probably get it. If we can’t get it we'll make it for you. Banneker points to a door at the top of a metal staircase

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Your quarters. Close to the work. A klaxon sounds: a massive locker descends into the Stagi Room on an elevator. The crate is marked with Marine insi and Vance’s name. Banneker gazes at a heavy crane: it leaps into motion. Li the locker from the elevator. Sets it down and withdraws.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: You keep doing that.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Doing what?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Controlling machines with your eyes. Elevators, doors, the crane. How's it work?

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: In the Agency, rank has its privileges.  24. He removes his cap. He is bald: a sleek metal crown cling his scalp. Its terminals pass through the skin into his h

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: When there are secrets to be kept, machines make the best servants. We don’t need many human helpers here. Vance keys his ID code into the massive locker. Thumbs th print reader. The case opens. Inside: Vance’s armor - and an arsenal of weapons and too Banneker peers into the locker. Inspects a rack of someth like wet-suits. He fingers one curiously. It's marked wit Vance's name and Captain's rank insignia.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Skinsuit. You wear it under the armor. Soaks up sweat, keeps your skin clean, heals wounds. It even scratches where you itch. Best of all, on a long mission it catheterizes you.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Yeah. You tend to have a love-hate relationship with your skinsuit.

dialogues.speaker: MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: Vance, wearing a skinsuit, stands in front of his armor.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Athena, wake up. Athena’s electronic voice speaks from the battle suit. ATHENA’S VOICE Captain Vance.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Open.  25. The battle-suit SPLITS OPEN like some strange mollusk - t helmet swings back, the body opens wide. Vance slips easily into the armor, and it closes around h He stands up wearing half a ton of metal.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Offworld Marine, ready for duty.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Very impressive. Come and see the repair job. We have a mock-up.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Hang on. Vance reaches into the locker and clamps a bulky apparatu onto his left forearm. He points it at Banneker. Its muzzle belches a blur of motion that makes Banneker flinch violently - but it’s only a rapid rotation of tool socket-wrench, chisel, hammer, pincers.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (grinning) Field engineer’s toolkit. Can’t hurt you. Behind Vance, unknown to him, the Staging Room machines t on him: the heavy crane hangs overhead, its quivering jaw ready to crush him. A pit opens at his heels. Security cannons awaken and take aim. Banneker relaxes, and the machines withdraw silently into shadows.

dialogues.speaker: TRAINING FACILITY
dialogues.text: Vance, in full armor, enters on Banneker’s heels. Apprent gape at the giant in their midst. A house-sized machine dominates the room. It’s shaped lik beetle’s head: two eye-like domes, a shell of armor plate One armored dome is torn raggedly open.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: This is a replica of Crawler Three’s comm array. We reproduced the damage from diagnostics. Vance takes in the complex machine. Shoots Banneker a loo  26.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Look, why am I here? You've got to have hundreds of engineers who could do this.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: The Offworld Marine battle suit is the toughest spacesuit there is. And it takes months of training to wear it. A skilled Marine was our best option. Vance walks up the module’s hull and inspects the damage. casually peels back the thick metal and peers inside. Banneker’s eyes widen at this feat of strength.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What did this?

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Unknown. Probably collision damage. Erix isn’t flat.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: It's not pretty. But it looks like the only real damage is this cable. It's an easy fix.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: (skeptically) There are components you have to move. Systems to shut down and restart in a certain order.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Easy. Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scientist Larson’s kingdom, a gallery of technical diagra and intricate mechanisms. Larson, Banneker, and Vance survey a huge scale model of Prometheus and its Crawlers. They cluster around the model of Crawler Three.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST LARSON
dialogues.text: Now when you complete this repair, watch out. Crawler Three’s going to start talking to Prometheus, and in less than a second they’1l exchange more information than a human brain handles in a lifetime. Crawler (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIENTIST LARSON (cont'd) Three’s going to find out it's late starting the Ocean Program. And right that second it'll launch its rockets, bound for the seas of Erix. Larson frowns. Four hatch-covers flip open on top of the model of Crawler Three. Four model rockets emerge. Larson lifts one with obvious pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: Big rockets. It’ll get hot for you. Around two thousand degrees Kelvin.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST LARSON
dialogues.text: Ten seconds or so. Only a second or two of peak heat.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: All right. I can ride that out.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST LARSON
dialogues.text: (grins) That’s a damned fancy suit.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (returning the smile) Yes, sir. What do these rockets do?

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST LARSON
dialogues.text: The oceans are the foundation of the biosphere. The rockets are loaded with bacteria designed to change...

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Captain Vance may have top-secret military clearance, but he has no clearance here. Tell him only what he needs to know. Vance and Banneker lock eyes. They’re not going to get al

dialogues.speaker: STAGING ROOM
dialogues.text: The Staging Room is deserted. Vance and Banneker enter.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: So what now?  28.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Now nothing. (off Vance's bewilderment) It's eight-o'clock. The end of our day. We’ll resume at eight tomorrow morning. Take some time to study the project. You have the files. Banneker turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What about food? I’m starving.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Talk to the terminal in your room. Food will come in the autovalet. Banneker disappears down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (shouting after him) The auto-what? VANCE’S QUARTERS A simple room with a desk, a holography table, and an industrial metal bed. A door opens onto a compact bathroo A panel in the wall stands open: the AUTOVALET, a deliver system. A dinner tray, demolished, sits on the desk. At the holograph table, Vance flips through data: maps of Erix...diagrams of Prometheus...diagrams of Crawler Three Under the table, his knee jumps with nervous tension.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Deserted. Vance strolls restlessly, hands in his pockets. security cannons track him as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: Vance palms the elevator switch: ACCESS DENIED.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSPORTER FACILITY
dialogues.text: Vance stands outside the door. Stares into the transporte cavern. Electricity flickers over the vast machinery.  29. In his face in this solitary moment, we see something extraordinary: fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ada Kildare greets Vance and Banneker at the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: (with a winning smile) Captain Vance. Welcome to the Planetology Division. I'm Ada Kildare.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Scientist Kildare...

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Ada.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Ada. Pleasure to meet you. She leads them through a tantalizing laboratory. Apprenti work at display screens filled with weather systems, satellite maps, complex data displays.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: This is where we study Erix. Geology, chemistry, biology, everything. She hustles them through the lab too fast to allow Vance good look around.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Biology? MARTIN CAUL’S OFFICE The den of a university professor: actual books on shelve holography table, huge display screens for data. Scientist Caul and Ada sit with Vance and Banneker. Caul scowls at Vance and strokes his beard.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: You'll have to tell me how I can help you, son. I'm no military man. Vance looks impatient.  30.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I have to travel a hundred kilometers across an alien planet, and back. I have no recon. What's the ground made of? Does it rain? What’s the rain made of? What about background radiation? Electrical storms. Volcanoes. Earthquakes...

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: All right, all right. Ada will get you an environmental survey... (he glances at Ada inquiringly)

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Tomorrow, first thing.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: And you said biology. There's life on Erix?

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: Of course. We couldn't terraform without biomass to work on.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Well, what are we talking about? Algae? Bugs? Little green men?

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: No, no, nothing like that. No intelligent life.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: You know that?

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: Certainly. There's no technology. No agriculture, no artificial structures, no roads. No controlled use of fire. No sign of social organization. We've been thorough.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: All right. So what is there?

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: Abundant plant and animal life. I can't be very detailed.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Listen. I’m combat-certified in low gravity, heavy gravity, and zero gravity. I can operate in vacuum, (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VANCE (cont'd) atmosphere, or underwater. But there's no training program for “aliens.” I need information. Caul glances nervously at Banneker.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: Please understand. Prometheus is a planetary terraforming system. I can tell you whether Erix's carbon cycle is positive or negative for the week. I can give you the chemical composition of any part of the planet to ten decimal places. I can give you details - but not the ones you want. You want to know if life on Erix could be dangerous to you. And we simply have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: TRAINING FACILITY
dialogues.text: Vance, in armor, practices the repair. Larson and a crew APPRENTICES look on. Vance’s right hand is tucked behind back; he works with his left. Vance finishes the repair, lifts his hand with a flourish Diagnostic lights flash to life.

dialogues.speaker: APPRENTICE
dialogues.text: System operational.

dialogues.speaker: APPRENTICE
dialogues.text: Three minutes forty-eight seconds. With one hand. Apprentices restore the mock-up to its damaged state for next practice run.

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: And no technical diagrams. Next you'll be doing it blindfolded. Vance looks at Larson mischievously. The mock-up is ready

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Athena. Blackout. Vance’s visor goes opaque. He gropes over the repair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance lets Ada in. She moves into the room, a little shy, looking around. Vance, suddenly self-conscious, gives the  32. place a quick scan, but there's nothing to tidy up: the r is immaculate. She peeks into his tiny bedroom: Vance's personal effects stashed meticulously; his bedsheets are taut as a drumhea

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: You really know how to make a bed.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Boot camp dies hard. Ada activates Vance's holograph table.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I brought you some more detailed maps and environmental data. A map of Erix rises from the table. Vance looks it over.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I've made notes where I could. Hazardous terrain, rainfall and wind conditions... Everything I could think of. Vance toggles the map through different overlays: tempera data, precipitation, geology...he stops at a display he doesn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) Biological material. Vegetation.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Just my luck. Looks like Prometheus landed in a hot spot.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: It wasn't chance. We chose a landing site rich in organic material. A jungle, really.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE'S QUARTERS
dialogues.text: Alone, Vance studies the map. He's been at it for a while pulls a REMOTE from his pocket and speaks into it.  33.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Athena. Wake up.

dialogues.speaker: STAGING ROOM
dialogues.text: The chest panel of Vance’s armor lights up. VANCE’S QUARTERS Athena’s voice emanates from the remote. ATHENA’S VOICE Captain. Vance plugs the remote into his holography table. Athena’ Greek-helmet icon appears in the corner of his display.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Tactical Model One. This is the planet Erix. ATHENA’S VOICE Model One. With a stylus, Vance touches a symbol on the map.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: This is Prometheus Ground Station. Call it longitude zero. ATHENA’S VOICE Longitude zero. Vance’s stylus floats over the map: across ridges and valleys, canyons and rivers. A long way. Touches again.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: This is Crawler Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance stands in front of Director Marbeck and the Scienti of the Governing Council, who sit around the table.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: After only two weeks, you say you're ready. Vance plugs his REMOTE into the Council table.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Athena. Tactical model 5B.  34. The map of Erix rises out of the table.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Display primary route. Secondary route. Tertiary route. Display hazards. Athena paints information across the map. A dense path of data connects the Ground Station to Crawler Three.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: (intrigued) You’ve altered that map.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: This is a Theater-Wide Tactical Model. It’s what the Corps uses. Athena has the whole region in memory.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: And the repair?

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: He can do it blind. I watched him.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: More prep is just over-training. I’m good to go.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: (to Scientist Rhay) The Transporter’s ready? (off Rhay’s nod) Very well. In the morning, Captain, you will go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance does push-ups, ticking them off like a metronome. He rises, breathing hard. The map of his mission glows on holography table: he circles the table, studying the map, focused and deadly serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance, in full armor, is checked over by a team of Apprentices. Banneker looks on. Vance’s breathing is slow and steady, his eyes far away.  35. At the last moment the Apprentices replace his “VANCE” ID plates with plates reading “VANCE 1.” Vance takes no noti

dialogues.speaker: TRANSPORT FACILITY
dialogues.text: Vance enters, hulking in his armor. Ada stands beside the door. Vance musters a smile.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Wish me luck.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Good luck, Conrad. Vance crosses the catwalk to the transport chamber. The Scientists watch from the Control Room window. All eyes on Vance. Tension palpable in the room. The transport chamber opens, spilling light into the cave

dialogues.speaker: RHAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you ready, Captain? Vance gives the thumbs-up.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Enter the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSPORT CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Vance steps inside. The door closes. He stands cramped in small, bright chamber. Breathing faster now.

dialogues.speaker: RHAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Charging. The vast dynamos of the Lang Transporter RUMBLE to life.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Athena. Transit to Erix. Stand by. ATHENA’S VOICE Standing by. The sound of the dynamos rises to a HOWL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New Washington stands pale against the dawn. A rolling BROWNOUT darkens the city’s lights.  36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scientists watch as electrical arcs spatter across th Transporter. The noise is incredible. Ada joins the other Scientists in the control room. They watch in fascination.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSPORT CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Vance closes his eyes against the light and noise. Sweat down his cheek. The dynamos reach a SCREAMING PITCH and hang there.

dialogues.speaker: RHAY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Full charge. On your signal.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Hit it. BOOM. Blinding light. Pure energy hammers through the transport chamber: for a split second Vance is a human lightning rod, a negative image, his mouth wide in an inaudible scream. Silence. Vance stands trembling, wisps of smoke rising from his ar He takes a shuddering breath. Opens his eyes. The chamber door grinds open - not the slim door he expec but a massive slab of armor plate. He looks out at...

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANET ERIX
dialogues.text: Smoky clouds race across a blood-red sky. Lightning flash and where it strikes a ribbon of fire twists and fades. The landscape is a jungle out of a child’s nightmare. Everything is moving. There’s no clear division between p and animal. It howls and rages and feeds on itself. Vance stares, transfixed with horror.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: My God.  37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prometheus towers out of the jungle, its vast ribs curvin into the sky like the bones of a giant. The ship’s descent has blasted a clearing in the jungle. tracks of the huge Crawlers lead away in all directions, highways of crushed vegetation and ruin. Vance steps out. The ground crunches under his boots. ATHENA’S VOICE Satellite system online.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Athena. Show me Crawler Three. A blue marker on his visor display points down the path t his left. Crawler Three is out of sight over the horizon. readout gives the distance: 124 KILOMETERS. Vance moves out into the clearing. VINES wriggle toward h across the ground. Vance, wide-eyed, skips back from them ATHENA’S VOICE Multiple targets incoming. PREDATORS burst from the jungle and head for Vance - big terrifyingly fast. Gleaming tusks jut from their shoulder Vance pulls his rifle - but the weapon is tangled in vine He pulls it free - too late. They’re on him. Tusks punch through his armor. Horrific wounds. His rifle fires convulsively. He dies. The gunfire shocks the jungle into motion. Winged things explode into flight, trees claw at the air. A vision of H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transport chamber’s door opens. Vance steps out onto catwalk. He’s untouched, his armor unmarked. A few thin wisps of smoke rise from his shoulders. He doe look like a man who's just seen his own death. In the Control Room the Scientists stand watching.  38.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I’m still here.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Technical difficulties, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: RHAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We're, ah, running tests. Vance looks up at the Control Room. The Scientists look d at him...all but Ada Kildare, who turns and vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Technical difficulties. But this is safe.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Perfectly safe in theory. It takes a week to recharge the transporter. One week. Until then - continue training.

dialogues.speaker: TRAINING FACILITY
dialogues.text: Vance, in armor, stands in front of the repair mock-up. Plainly sick of doing this. He sighs heavily. He gestures, and the toolkit extrudes from his armored gauntlet. He starts the repair. INT. VANCE’S QUARTERS - DAY (A WEEK LATER) Vance sits wearily at his small holography table. His tactical map of Erix glows in the darkened room. A KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Come in. Banneker steps in, all business.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: The transporter’s ready. You go in the morning. Eight-o’clock.

dialogues.speaker: PROMETHEUS PROJECT
dialogues.text: Vance, in armor, steps into the chamber for the second ti His ID tags read VANCE 2. The door closes behind him.  39.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSPORT CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Vance stands cramped in the tiny chamber.

dialogues.speaker: RHAY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Stand by...on your signal. Again the dynamos howl in leashed fury.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Go. A BOOM and a blinding FLASH. Energy slams through him - and then Vance stands shudderi in the transport chamber. The door opens. Vance steps out into the...

dialogues.speaker: TRANSPORT FACILITY
dialogues.text: Vance looks up at the Control Room window where the Scientists stand.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Patience, we’re almost there. One more week. We’ll try again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance, wearing a headset, tinkers with his armor.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (into headset) Sensor diagnostic. Execute. ATHENA’S VOICE Diagnostic running. (O.S.) AGITATED VOICES in the distance. Vance looks up. In the corridor outside, Scientist Bannek and Ada Kildare are arguing. Vance lifts a headphone away from his ear, listens. The thick window muffles their voi

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Cancel diagnostic. Tactical sound. Isolate voices.  40. ATHENA’S VOICE Tactical sound. An oceanic roar resolves into speech.

dialogues.speaker: ADA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, how can he do better if you don’t tell him what’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We’re obliged to protect certain secrets.

dialogues.speaker: ADA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You make no sense. You're hiding the problem you want him to solve. They move away down the hall, and the conversation is los Vance pulls his headset off, pondering. INT. PROMETHEUS PROJECT - VANCE’S MISSION ROOM - NIGHT Vance lies on his bed, the room lit by the shifting light a holograph: bloody Erix orbiting its pale sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance, in full armor, steps once more into the

dialogues.speaker: TRANSPORT CHAMBER
dialogues.text: The door closes over him as the dynamos howl. The tags on armor read VANCE 3. BOOM. Lightning strikes inside the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electricity crackles over the immense terraforming ship. The transporter door opens. Vance emerges, trailing wisps smoke. Gapes again at the alien wilderness. ATHENA’S VOICE Captain. Marines down.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (in disbelief) What?  4l. Two CASUALTY MARKERS hover in his visor display. He inspe the fallen shapes with telescopic vision. Sees the shatte armor, reads the ID tags: VANCE 1, VANCE 2.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: You bastards. What have you done? ATHENA’S VOICE Satellite system online. Vance scans the jungle. Nothing to see. He notices a fall RIFLE beside one of the fallen Marines. Sprints for it. ATHENA’S VOICE Incoming. Multiple targets. Vance gets the rifle. Three PREDATORS are closing on him. He BLASTS them, a rifle in each hand. The gunfire tears into the predators. They stagger, ragin against their injuries, and go down. Vance relaxes - and his visor LIGHTS UP with warning mark ATHENA’S VOICE Incoming. Incoming. Incoming. PREDATORS erupt from the jungle. The leaders pounce and V jumps away on jets, rifles blazing mid-air. He lands running. They stay with him, flanking him. Vance leaps over a SABER TREE and the tree snatches him o of the air, piercing his armor with curved blades. He die

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transport chamber door slides open. Vance, unhurt, st out into the laboratory, visibly angry. From the Control Room the Scientists look down at him.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Apologies, Captain. It looks like we're not quite there yet. Vance stares suspiciously. He zooms in telescopically on Director's face. Marbeck is smiling.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Athena. Open up. His armor releases him.  42.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Captain?

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM ACCESS CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Vance emerges from the elevator in his black skinsuit. He got something hidden in his hand. Banneker stands at the Control Room door. Vance brushes p him and palms the door switch. Nothing happens. Banneker slides between Vance and the door.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: The Control Room is a restricted... Vance applies an armlock. Plants Banneker’s hand on the d switch. The door slides open.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Director Marbeck stands waiting. Around him, technicians at elaborate consoles. Vance enters. Banneker follows, rubbing his twisted arm.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Captain. Vance takes in the monitors and controls. He scans the fa of the technicians.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: You’re not disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: You’re not disappointed. (points at the techs) They're not trying to figure out what's wrong. They’re just sitting there. Job's done. He holds up an ID tag from his armor. It reads VANCE 3.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Vance Three. What does that mean? What is that machine doing to me?  43.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: (to Banneker) Here’s what comes of recruiting the headstrong problem-solver. (to Vance) Captain, you won't get what you want by making demands of me in front of my staff. Your concern is noted. Banneker, if you will. Banneker reaches for Vance’s arm as if to escort him out. Vance stops him cold with an admonishing finger.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Not on your best day. He flings the ID plate at Marbeck’s feet.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Do you know what battle readiness is, Director? It’s the vital thing that bleeds away when you keep soldiers in the trenches too long. When you tell them every day that battle is coming, and it never comes. I'm in the dark here. I don't know what we're doing. And at this rate, when something finally happens, I won't be ready. Marbeck struggles visibly with his temper, and wins. He t a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: You're right. The Lang Transporter hasn't failed. It works perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: And what does it do?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: You said it yourself. Faster-than- light travel is not possible. The Transporter works by another principle.

dialogues.speaker: RHAY
dialogues.text: Conrad, the Lang Transporter has two chambers. One here, and one on Prometheus. The system exploits quantum superposition to create virtual particles in... Vance tries to follow this. Shakes his head in frustratio

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Just give me the bottom line.

dialogues.speaker: RHAY
dialogues.text: Sorry. The Lang Transporter doesn’t “transport” things. It duplicates them. It samples whatever’s in one chamber and creates a perfect copy in the other chamber. We've created copies of you on Erix three times. A moment of silence rolls by. Vance stares at the Scienti

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Copies of me. On Erix.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: The Transporter allows you to stand on Earth and cast your shadow on another world. The men we sent to Erix were you, in a sense, with your abilities, your memories, your intentions...but you remain.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: And you didn’t feel the need to tell me this. What are you doing? Building an army over there? He stares out at the Transporter brooding in its cavern.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: There’s no army. Your first two duplicates, your shadows on Erix, died within minutes. Your third shadow is most likely dying as we speak. Vance - a man who has never been wounded - is stunned. He glances at the VANCE 3 nameplate on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I died.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Your shadows died. Vance looks at Marbeck, grappling with the unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Show me.  45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scientists stand around the holography table: Directo Marbeck and Scientists Banneker, Caul, Rhay and Larson. Vance, back in regular uniform, faces them across the tab IN HOLOGRAPH: Grainy satellite video of the Prometheus Gr Station.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Prometheus, seen from orbit. Vance points at the landscape surrounding Prometheus.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What’s all this movement?

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: The jungle. IN HOLOGRAPH: Electrical energy erupts from the Station.

dialogues.speaker: RHAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That energy discharge is the creation of a large mass. The image zooms in. A blurry figure emerges from the Stat

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That's you. Or rather, the first copy of you. Call him Shadow One. SHAPES burst from the jungle and overwhelm Shadow One.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What's that? What are those? A data marker pops up, recording the death.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: Aliens.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Native predators. Vance shakes his head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Death at one minute eighteen seconds. Director Marbeck cues the next holographic recording.  46.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Second arrival, one week later. Your second duplicate, Shadow Two, exits the station. Gunfire. Death at two minutes fifty-one seconds.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: Same type of predator.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Maybe territorial. Vance watches, frozen with amazement and rage.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Third arrival, just hours ago. Shadow Three.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: He picked up a second weapon.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Extended gunfire here. Vance stares, completely absorbed.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Two kills. Three.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Apparently. Shadow Three flees. He is pursued. Death at four minutes twenty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Twenty meters off the ground. Looks like he got stuck in a tree. Vance scans the faces around the table, settles on Ada.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Is this real? Is that me?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: It's real. Believe it. Vance stares at the flickering images. When he looks up there's fire in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: You knew this was happening. And you sent me - copies of me - into that hell with the same equipment and the same plan, every time. What did you expect the third time?  47.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: You can’t plot a curve with one or two data points...

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Look. I’m no scientist. I don't have your expertise. But this isn’t science. It’s combat. And that’s what I do. (to Marbeck) Do you want this done? Do you want to save your terraforming program?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: You know I do. It must be done.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Your “Shadow Three” took some of those monsters down with a light rifle. Whatever they are, they die. Let me pick the weapons and plan the op. I’1l do this thing. Marbeck looks at Vance as if seeing him for the first tim

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: You believe it can be done?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I’1ll get it done. On these conditions: You give me the data I need. I don't care how you do the paperwork. Just answer my questions.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Agreed.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (pointing at Banneker) And I don’t need a handler. Get him off my back. Scientist Banneker’s outraged glance finds no audience.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Scientist Banneker will assist you - as you see fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance sits with Scientist Caul and Ada around Caul's holography table.  48.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: Congratulations. You're the first non-Scientist ever to hold a level- one SSA security clearance.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: So are you done lying to me? His eyes fall on Ada. Caul notices.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: Don't blame Ada. At this level of security, a slip of the tongue can be high treason. She could forfeit her career, her freedom... even her life.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: The writ of secrecy you signed is no joke.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: And now you're in even deeper. Level-one secrets are practically radioactive.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Are you trying to scare me?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: He's trying to keep you safe.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (surrendering) I get it. So talk to me about aliens.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: When we sent Prometheus to Erix, we expected to find life. The planet's chemistry implied life. But how much? What kind? He gestures, and a globe of Erix rises from the holograph table. It's an infrared display: the seas are cool in sha of blue: the continents hot with life.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: No one was prepared for the data we got back. Erix has twice the biomass of Earth. More life than Earth has ever carried.  49.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Great for terraforming. Lots of biomass to work with.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: And what lives there?

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: We don't know much. Between the jungle canopy and heavy cloud cover...we get glimpses. We've catalogued hundreds of organisms from rabbit-sized creatures to things bigger than anything on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Dinosaur-sized.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Well, technically, bigger than dinosaurs. Vance stares.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: (encouragingly) They might be plant-eaters.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: You should expect great diversity. It's a wilderness.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Well, a Marine who's done more than a hundred combat ops walked into that wilderness wearing one of the finest weapons systems ever built, and was torn to pieces in minutes. Three tries, and every time he died in minutes. I have to know how that’s possible.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: (to Ada) Show him the simulator.

dialogues.speaker: BIOSIMULATOR FACILITY
dialogues.text: Ada and Vance stand in front of a large holographic tank. Strange shapes writhe in the hologram: unborn monsters mutating in the womb. Vance stares, aghast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I looking at?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: We have DNA sequences from samples taken all over Erix.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: DNA? Like us?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Yes and no. They have three base pairs instead of two - and not the same ones. What you see is our computers trying to imagine the organism this DNA sequence might create. It’s a very hard problem. 50. Vance stares at the shifting shapes. They gleam with meta spines, scales, blades. Unfinished demons.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: You think you've got problems.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Erix is richer in heavy elements than Earth. Tungsten, chromium, titanium. Living things on Erix incorporate those metals.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: They’re made of titanium?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Partly. Some of them. Erix also has twice the background radiation of Earth. That means a higher mutation rate: faster evolution. So the natural arms race that produces tiger claws and turtle shells and porcupine quills on Earth...

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Produces military hardware on Erix.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: It’s a safe bet.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Vance catches up to Banneker in a hallway. He talks fire as they stride along. rapid-  51.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I want new armor. Ten-gauge plate on a heavy-planet chassis.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: One Kehlor R-10 Railgun. Ten thousand armor-piercing rounds. One hundred Mark-Six field grenades. Extended flamethrower tank. Got that? Banneker doesn’t bat an eye.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: I have it. You can carry all this?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I‘ll find a way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls are display screens densely covered with equati and complex diagrams. Vance faces Scientist Cordelia Rhay across her desk.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: How do I know these copies of me are capable? Maybe my Shadows fail because something’s wrong with them.

dialogues.speaker: RHAY
dialogues.text: You don’t understand. What the Transporter sends is you. The process is perfect. The man on Erix is as much you as you are. What you know, he knows. What you can do, he can do. Don’t ask me what your Shadows are capable of: you’re the only one who knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new, more massive suit of armor stands in its rack. Van welds extra ammo pods to the armor. Nearby, Apprentices unpack enough ammunition for a regime  52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fantastic electrical display erupts from the Station, lightning stabbing into the clouds from the giant machine SHADOW FOUR steps out in heavy armor, railgun in one hand missile launcher in the other. He stares in grim determination at the jungle reflected i his visor. The badge on his helmet reads VANCE 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance stands at the wall. His armor’s first three ID plat are bolted up there: VANCE 1, VANCE 2, VANCE 3. He bolts a new plate up at the bottom of the column: VANC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larson and Vance examine Larson’s scale model of Promethe Larson looks up from their work with a sudden boyish smil

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: Think. You’re the first man ever to leave the solar system. The first man to stand under an alien sun. It's historical. Do you feel it?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: That's a grand way to put it. But yeah, I feel it.

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: I felt it. Building Prometheus. With Scientist Rhay, and Scientist Caul, and Director Marbeck. Far from home. Jupiter hanging over us.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: How many people built Prometheus?

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: Three thousand. And thousands of machines.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: With that many people, how'd you keep it secret? The old Scientist's good humor fades away.  53.

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: When Director Marbeck wants silence, he get silence. INT. PROMETHEUS PROJECT - VANCE’S MISSION ROOM - DAY Ada peers into the map table. Vance leans over her should He stands close; they’ve grown comfortable with one anoth IN HOLOGRAM: a satellite map of Erix. Shadow Four's fatal marker blinks, a lonely star in the alien wilderness.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Shadow Four did five-point-three kilometers before he died. Shadow Five carried more missiles. IN HOLOGRAM: Shadow Five emerges from Prometheus and blaz into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: He goes through his missiles in two hours. At two point five hours, he visits the body of Shadow Four.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Why? Something there can kill him.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Must have been something he wanted badly. He watches her with a half-smile: testing her.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Ammunition.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Right. At five hours he stops shooting. I think his rifle failed. It'd be red-hot by then. After the rifle quits he doesn't last thirty seconds. He did seven kilometers. The image freezes.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: That's progress. But it’s a hundred kilometers to Crawler Three.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (nodding) I don’t think we’re going to get (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VANCE (cont'd) through the jungle. But you said there's less life in the highlands. Vance taps his remote. IN HOLOGRAM: A new trail paints itself across the landsca scaling the cliffs to the highlands, traveling many kilometers, and descending again near Crawler Three.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: It’s a hell of a climb, and it’s a longer trip. But I think Shadow Six should take the high road. I know I’ve been demanding data on the jungle. But now I need everything you can give me on the highlands.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I have it ready. But I want to show you something first. Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: SERVICE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Ada leads Vance down an unfamiliar industrial passage. Sh can’t quite suppress a smile. Vance is perplexed. Ada palms a door open, revealing a freight elevator. He follows her in.

dialogues.speaker: FREIGHT ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: The doors close. Vance looks up. The elevator is an open platform: the concrete shaft seems to go up forever. Ada palms the switch. Nothing happens. Ada scowls. Then the elevator ROCKETS upward. The walls hurtle past. grab for the railings. Ada grins from ear to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trap door in the roof slides open. The elevator rises i view and locks into place. Vance is astonished. They step onto the roof. The sun drenches New Washington in golden light. Traffic sparkles. Buildings shine. Clouds scud overhead.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I heard you asked to go outside.  55.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: The Director said no. Security risk. The elevators refuse me.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I thought maybe Security wouldn't consider the roof “outside.” Vance stands at the edge of the roof, drinking in the vie He can’t stop smiling.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I’ve been off-planet so long. It’s been killing me to be back home, but trapped underground. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I wish I’d thought of it sooner. She stands close. Vance touches the shoulder of her coat.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: White coats, gray coats, black coats. What do they call you gray- coated Scientists?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: White coats are for Novices. Gray for Apprentices, black for Masters.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: So you're an Apprentice.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I’ve been offered the mastery, more than once. That’s an honor at my age. But I haven’t accepted.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: There are things that go with mastery I’m not comfortable with.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: The hardware under the hats.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: You know about that?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Banneker showed me his.  56.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: It's called the cybernetic crown. Banneker was the youngest Scientist ever to receive it. He’s proud. She pauses, looking out over the city.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: After your coronation, you absorb information faster than before. You calculate faster. You have total recall. And you can control the Agency's devices. Masters do science at a higher level. Vance nods in understanding - he relates to this idea.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: In my armor I see farther, move faster. I can almost fly.
