dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: But you can take the armor off. With the crown there’s no going back. You're different forever. And it’s classified technology: after your coronation the Agency owns a part of you. They always know where you are, and you're no longer free to leave. The job's forever. Vance scowls in distaste at that idea.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I've only been here a couple of months and I've had enough.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: And sometimes the crown changes people. Maybe one Scientist in ten...they stop socializing. Lose their taste for ordinary pleasures.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Which pleasures?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Take your pick. The crown touches everything. She parts her hair with her fingers, touching one point a another.  57.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Two terminals in the frontal lobe. Two in the parietal, two in the temporal, one in the occipital. Her fingers form a cage around the top of her head. Vance slides his fingers into her hair. Pulls her hands away.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I like you better this way. She closes her eyes for a moment. Takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Charging into battle?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (letting go) Sorry, I... She kisses him. He pulls her in, pressing her body agains him. After a long moment she breaks for air, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I've been in space a long time. He starts to unbutton her gray coat. She lets him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dry flatland studded with rocks and low, twisted trees. SHADOW SEVEN flees across the plain, firing on the run. T shadows of winged creatures spiral around him on the grou A WINGED RAPTOR smashes him to the ground, its talons piercing his armor. He dies. Other raptors land. They squabble over the body. Time accelerates. The sun hurtles across the sky. The raptors fly off, revealing broken armor, a ravaged bo Night and day flicker past. Alien vermin swarm over the corpse. The armor corrodes and collapses on itself. The f withers to a bare skull. Seven days pass. Time slows. Resumes its normal pace. An armored boot plants itself before Shadow Seven’s unsee eyes. SHADOW EIGHT stares down at the body.  58. After a moment Shadow Eight stoops. Takes the dead man’s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance and Ada sit at the large holography table, reviewin the progress of Shadow Nine. It's late, and they are wear their heads propped on their hands. IN HOLOGRAPH: Shadow Nine struggles through the jungle - tiny, indistinct figure. Swarming shapes pursue him. Flashes of light as he fires rifle, his grenade launcher, his jump jets. He stops moving. A fatality marker pops up on the display Scientist Caul appears behind them. Looks gravely at Vanc

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: How many times can you watch this? Vance glances up at the old Scientist and nods. Restarts recording. The flickering light plays across his face.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: That's my twin down there. My brother. He's dying.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: That's what I mean. Can't be good for you.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Every choice he makes is a message. Every mistake. His death is a lesson. All I can do to honor his sacrifice is learn from it.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: I guess I haven't given much thought to what your duplicates go through. Vance nods, his eyes far away.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: When I have a Shadow fighting on Erix, I'm so aware of it I can almost feel it happening. Ada has been tapping at an electronic slate. She looks up  59.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I've been working the other side of the problem. Understanding what the Monsters are thinking. I have the computer sort the aliens into types using size and behavior. Then I do game-theory analysis on their movements. She taps her slate. Diagrams fill the display: circling patterns, swarming movements - annotated in symbolic logi Scientist Caul's eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: Semantic analysis of group dynamics! You may have invented a new sub-discipline. I want to try it myself.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (bewildered) Try what exactly?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I'm watching the predators think. Species A defend their territory but won't leave it. Species B won't attack you if you hold still. Species C will follow you in ones and twos, but only attack in groups. There are rules.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Now that's military intelligence. Can you show me on a map?

dialogues.speaker: PLANETOLOGY CENTER
dialogues.text: Scientist Caul sits at his desktop terminal. In holograph before him, small shapes move over the surface of Erix. The computer traces their complex paths. Equations appear the air as the computer responds to Caul's thoughts. Scientist Caul leans forward intently, the light playing his face.

dialogues.speaker: STAGING ROOM
dialogues.text: The industrial space is dim and deserted. The window of Vance's quarters glows at the top of its staircase.  60. Ada steals through the Staging Room and up the stairs. Sl into Vance's room.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE'S QUARTERS
dialogues.text: Vance and Ada lie naked and entangled on Vance’s narrow c Ada pores over Vance’s muscles with her hands.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: All these scars.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Every trooper takes his hits. A few get through the armor.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: You're lucky to be alive.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: It's not just luck.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: So proud. The ladies must love you. Are there ladies, in space?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: The Corps is fifteen percent women. But they’re not like you.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: (laughing) I would hope not! You’re not what I’m used to either.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: You sure this won’t make trouble for you? People must know you come here.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: We have to report personal relationships inside the Agency. But you’re not a Scientist. (grins) You’re a Captain in the Offworld Marines.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: And you like that.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I like that.  61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHADOW THIRTEEN races through the undergrowth, a gun in e hand. Whistling SPINES like arrows tear through the jungl around him, skipping off tree-trunks. He emerges into a clearing...and stops short. SCORPIONS w for him there: monstrosities whose tails hurl deadly spin Pursuing Scorpions burst from the jungle behind him. Caug in the middle, he leaps to the top of a round rock. Scorpions swarm out of the jungle, surrounding him. He pi in place, guns raised. Hope drains from his face. He starts shooting. A storm of spines flies in answer. INT. VANCE’S QUARTERS - MORNING (EARTH) Vance slams awake, bathed in sweat, panting. The clock says 5:30 AM. Ada lies beside him, her skin shining in the half-light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marbeck sits at his grand desk. In front of him, Scientis Caul paces restlessly on the fine carpet.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: Jarod. It's over. Caul sounds almost threatening, but Marbeck responds with good-natured disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Martin. This kind of sentimentality is beneath you.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: How can you hear what I've found and still go through with this?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: How can you ask? Erix is the greatest gift ever given to the human race. It's my life's work.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: You and your legacy. The world won't stand for it, once they know.  62. Marbeck comes to his feet, all silky menace.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Who's going to tell them, Martin? You? The question affects Caul like a loaded gun. He freezes.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: I should never have joined you in this. It was a devil's bargain. The door behind him opens. Guards enter the room.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Call it what you will. It was a bargain. INT. PROMETHEUS PROJECT - VANCE’S QUARTERS - DAY (EARTH) Vance sits at his holography table. Shadow Thirteen's fatality marker winks on the map. Director Marbeck appears behind Vance.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Thirteen attempts, Captain. Thirteen weeks lost. Thirteen disruptions of the city’s power. More conspicuous requisitions for weaponry. Indignant, Vance pivots in his chair to face Marbeck.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What do you want from me? I'm moving mountains here! Nobody's ever done anything like this. (he points at the map) I'm getting there. That's progress!

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: You belong to my project now. If you ever want to get back to your life, back to your platoon... (almost snarling) ...then don’t give me progress, Captain. Succeed.

dialogues.speaker: STAGING ROOM
dialogues.text: Brooding and stressed, Vance surveys his arsenal: racks o guns, piles of munitions. Banneker stands behind him.  63.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: I know. You want something better. Vance shakes his head helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: There is nothing better. These are the best... (his eyes go wide) I'm so stupid!

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: That's what I keep telling you.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I thought I was using the best weapons and armor available. But I’m not. I’m using the best stuff available in the field.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: As opposed to...?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: The Arsenal in Nevada has experimental weapons. They make field-issue gear look like toys. They're too expensive to put in harm’s way... Banneker gets it and comes around at once.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: But you can use them without risk. What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: A flight to Nevada. And when I get there - anything I ask for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance looks out the window of a supersonic plane. America rolls by far below. The curvature of the Earth is visible. Behind him, the sun rises. Above, he can see sta A fully armed SSA guard sits beside Vance. Banneker sits across from him beside a second guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A military troop carrier barrels down a desert road.  64. Vance sits up front with the driver; Banneker and the gua hunker uncomfortably in the back. Vance and his escort arrive at a remote desert facility: Nevada Arsenal of the Department of Defense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISABEL GARVEY, 50, stands waiting. She’s a lean, rangy wo in plain service uniform, sleeves rolled up. Vance, Banneker, and their guards enter. Banneker approac Garvey officiously.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Rune Banneker, Scientist... Garvey brushes past Banneker to Vance.

dialogues.speaker: GARVEY
dialogues.text: Captain Vance? Colonel Isabel Garvey. Chief Weapons Master. She sticks out a hand. Vance shakes it, grins at her grip

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: GARVEY
dialogues.text: This way. Vance and Garvey stride briskly away, forcing Banneker an his guards to hurry after them.

dialogues.speaker: GARVEY
dialogues.text: Your combat reports are required reading here. We redesigned the G-4 rocket launcher based on your feedback.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: The new G-4 is outstanding. Smooth. Fast on the reload.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY CHECKPOINT
dialogues.text: Plexiglass barriers, armed sentries, automatic guns. Vance and the Garvey sweep through the checkpoint unchallenged. The sentries block Banneker and his guards.  65.

dialogues.speaker: GARVEY
dialogues.text: (to Vance) You're the only one cleared for the Armory. You need these guys? Vance grins at Banneker on the far side of the barricade.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: No. Banneker glares as Vance and the Lieutenant stride away.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORY
dialogues.text: Garvey and Vance stride along a corridor, trailed by two subordinate officers who tag along at Garvey's beck and c

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I need the best armor you have. And weapons.

dialogues.speaker: GARVEY
dialogues.text: Do you understand how valuable these prototypes are?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: They'll be safe. Barely handled.

dialogues.speaker: GARVEY
dialogues.text: You need ‘em ready to use, but you're not going to use them.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I know that sounds strange.

dialogues.speaker: GARVEY
dialogues.text: Sounds like you took a few hits to the helmet.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORY
dialogues.text: Garvey leads Vance past a fantastic gallery of armor prototypes: slim black stealth suits; five-ton demolition suits; suits with massive specialized weapons. They pass a rack of massive axes and machetes too heavy t lift without armor. They stop beside a gorgeous silver armor with fluid lines Vance takes to it immediately.  66.

dialogues.speaker: GARVEY
dialogues.text: Here’s the crown jewel. Diamond fiber plate. Hardest thing going. And lighter, so we can bulk up the chassis, the power plant, the motors. Stronger and faster than current models.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: This is what I need. Vance is already headed for the exit. Garvey follows, protesting.

dialogues.speaker: GARVEY
dialogues.text: I knew you’d say that. It’s the only suit of its kind.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I'll take good care of it. They pass the rack of massive machetes. Vance points.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: And get me one of those.

dialogues.speaker: WEAPONS LAB
dialogues.text: Garvey shows Vance a rack of identical supermodern rifles They are bulky and ponderous: designed for powered armor.

dialogues.speaker: GARVEY
dialogues.text: The Milburn M20 railgun. Next generation rifle. Vance heaves a railgun out of the rack. With a speed that belies the weapons weight, he checks the safety; cracks t Magazine open, checks the load, closes it; cocks the weap loudly, chambering a round. Nearby technicians look up as the weapon goes live. Vance hauls the rifle to his shoulder - arms trembling un the burden. He flicks the gunsight on. The scope paints l across his eyes. Vance shuts the rifle down and drops it into the rack.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Nice. But it's just a bigger, better machine gun. I want the experimental stuff. I want an energy weapon.  67.

dialogues.speaker: GARVEY
dialogues.text: A handheld energy weapon? There's no such thing. Vance looks her steadily in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: You know what I'm here for. Garvey stares back at him, her defiance crumbling. She si

dialogues.speaker: DARK OPS LAB
dialogues.text: A WEAPONS DESIGNER looks up from his workbench: a gaunt m of 50 in high-tech goggles that magnify his eyes. Garvey and Vance stand in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: WEAPONS DESIGNER
dialogues.text: Borrow the Valkyrie!? (he peers at Vance) You're Conrad Vance.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: WEAPONS DESIGNER
dialogues.text: You're a one-man destruction test. You've abused or broken every weapon in the arsenal.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (grinning) Not the Valkyrie.

dialogues.speaker: WEAPONS LOCKER
dialogues.text: The Valkyrie hangs behind shatterproof glass: a sleek ene rifle. It's polished to perfection, but toolmarks and wel betray its handmade origin. The Weapons Designer hands the Valkyrie to Vance.

dialogues.speaker: GARVEY
dialogues.text: Valkyrie Laser Rifle. It'll punch a hole through twenty centimeters of carbon steel. Ten thousand discharges on a single power cell. Vance smiles, hefting the weapon. He thumbs it on: the Valkyrie activates with a deep throb of power.  68.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Tough enough for field use?

dialogues.speaker: WEAPONS DESIGNER
dialogues.text: I made it myself. But it's a test unit! You can't just... Garvey waves him quiet.

dialogues.speaker: GARVEY
dialogues.text: He can. Vance points into the weapons case: another weapon hangs beneath the Valkyrie.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: WEAPONS DESIGNER
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Antimatter grenade launcher. Vance flashes Garvey a big smile. She sighs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scientist Ada Kildare arrives at Scientist Caul's office, is shocked to find the door flanked by SSA guards. She enters to find Scientist Caul and Director Marbeck waiting for her. Marbeck has a cold and malevolent air. Scientist Caul loo both furious and frightened; his hands are fists. Ada picks up the vibe in the room. Looks warily from Marb to Caul.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: You called for me? Marbeck looks promptingly at Caul.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: Ada. I'll no longer be with the Project, as of today. His voice is taut, emotionally loaded.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: wah , (dismayed) Ly é  69.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: I can no longer perform my function here. I'm sorry, I'd explain if I could. But you can see my situation. The Director's chosen you to succeed me. (with a significant look) I told him you're smart enough to do the job, and wise enough to do your duty. Ada frowns at Caul, sensing deeper meaning in the words b unable to grasp it.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: (to Caul) That's all.

dialogues.speaker: CAUL
dialogues.text: (to Marbeck) Go to hell. Caul turns and leaves the office. The SSA guards outside door fall into step and escort him away. Ada turns to Marbeck in consternation.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: You're now the Chief of Planetology. You have more than enough to think about. Ada begins to reply hotly, but bites her tongue; there's going on than she understands.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: I’ve read your reports. You’ve been working long hours.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: (warily) With so much data coming through...

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: For the past seven weeks, you've also been spending your nights with our hired barbarian. I suppose I shouldn't be shocked. Young, fit specimens in close quarters...it’s biologically predictable. Ada stares, shocked at this invasion.  70.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: It’s not forbidden.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: It’s not wise. We Scientists must guard our objectivity.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Objectivity? Conrad’s a colleague, not an experiment.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Twice you've refused the crown. You could have been the youngest ever. Younger than Banneker. Now that your responsibilities have grown, it's time you became a Master.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: It's my choice. You can’t force it on me.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: At times in the past, times of crisis, Scientists have been compelled to take the crown.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: (horrified) What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: We do great things here. Don't complicate the work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garvey leads Vance back toward the lobby of the Arsenal. A YOUNG FUNCTIONARY catches up to them at a run. Whispers urgently in Garvey's ear. Garvey's eyes widen in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: GARVEY
dialogues.text: Follow me. She hustles Vance back the way they came, away from Banne Banneker watches them retreat in renewed frustration. Garvey rounds a corner and stops at a pair of double door

dialogues.speaker: GARVEY
dialogues.text: Stand up straight and watch your manners.  71.

dialogues.speaker: MEETING ROOM
dialogues.text: Three dignitaries sit behind a long table: a distinguishe MAN IN A SUIT flanked by two GENERALS, a man and a woman. generals' chests are buried in decorations. Vance follows Garvey in and snaps to attention, eyes wide with surprise. He stares at the man in the suit: Defense Secretary Gideo Dain, seen earlier on a news broadcast in the Spaceport.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY DAIN
dialogues.text: Captain Vance. I’m Gideon Dain, Secretary of Defense.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I know, sir. The young functionary scurries to Vance's side with a cha Vance sits. The functionary presses a cup of coffee into hand. Vance relaxes a bit.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY DAIN
dialogues.text: Your flight's in less than an hour. I'll keep this brief. Vance sips coffee. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY DAIN
dialogues.text: The Department of Defense relies on the State Science Agency for key technologies. When they requested a Marine for special duty, I couldn't easily say no. I’m beginning to regret that decision. I want to know what this project's about.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I signed a writ of secrecy, sir. I can't say much.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY DAIN
dialogues.text: Ever since you arrived, there have been weekly power fluctuation in New Washington. Whenever they occur, we detect an energy pulse with the profile of no known device. But there is a theoretical device that would create that kind of energy pulse. It’s called a Lang (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SECRETARY DAIN (cont'd) Transporter. No working model has ever been built, or so we thought. Have you ever heard the term “Lang Transporter,” Captain?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Yes. The generals exchange meaningful looks. SECRETARY DAIN le forward intently.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY DAIN
dialogues.text: Where are they sending you with all those guns?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: You’re telling me the government doesn’t know what Marbeck's doing? There’s a strained silence. The generals watch Vance grav

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY DAIN
dialogues.text: That’s what I’m telling you.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I can’t tell you where they send me. But I'll tell you this: you've never been there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance emerges from the elevators in his dress uniform. Th security cannon takes aim at him. VANCE’S QUARTERS Vance hangs up his uniform. Steps to his comm terminal. Punches Ada’s name. The response flashes: UNAVAILABLE. VANCE’S QUARTERS —- HOURS LATER Vance lies in bed, staring at the door. No one comes. Ris he dials Ada again: UNAVAILABLE. Sighing, he rolls back into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance approaches the transport chamber in his gleaming ne armor and weaponry: laser rifle, grenade launcher, giant machete.  73. This is his first attempt at Erix in his experimental gea His ID tag reads VANCE 14. In the Control Room, the Scientists look on - Ada among t Vance vanishes into the transport chamber. The transporte howls as it charges. A BLINDING FLASH. Vance emerges, a veil of smoke rising from his armor. He stalks away without so much as a glance at the Control Ro

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Now we'll see.

dialogues.speaker: STAGING ROOM
dialogues.text: Vance tinkers his new battle suit, still in the skinsuit wears beneath his armor.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (into headset) Athena. Sensor check. ATHENA answers in Ada's voice. The sound is more resonant the new armor. ATHENA’S VOICE Sensor check running. Stand by.

dialogues.speaker: ADA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She’s a beauty. Vance turns: Ada stands behind him.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (quietly) You're not taking my calls.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Things have changed. Martin Caul left the Project while you were gone. I'm replacing him. Suddenly I'm under a magnifying glass.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I don't really understand what's happening. Martin was forced out. He's in some kind of trouble. O.S. Voices in the corridor.  74. Banneker enters, talking to a couple of Apprentices. Seei Vance and Ada talking, he stares in their direction. Ada shies away from Vance.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I need some distance for a while.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I have to talk to you. But Ada’s already drifting away, brow furrowed with anxie

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I can't. I'm sorry. Vance watches her go. DIRECTOR MARBECK’S OFFICE - DAY An immense, aristocratic room. Director Marbeck sits behi his massive desk, staring into a data terminal. Vance enters unannounced. He has a serious air.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Captain! An unexpected pleasure. Vance ignores the false pleasantry. Pulls up a chair and sits. A moment passes before he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Back when I was still new to the Corps, my platoon was called up for a secret op. We did a night drop with two other platoons on a Hegemony base on Venus. My platoon secured the perimeter. Second platoon cut the comm lines and jammed radio. The third platoon went inside. We heard a lot of shooting. When we dusted off, the third platoon looked shaky. They said they'd just killed a bunch of civilians. Combat report said we hit a hard target, but it wasn't true. It was a research station. I don't know why we hit it.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: (impatiently) What lesson am I supposed to...  75.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: A few weeks later it all blew up. There was a top-secret shitstorm. Our base commander resigned. They broke up my platoon and sent us to other units. They broke up the second platoon the same way. But the third platoon, the guys who did the shooting, they went up on charges. War crimes. That was ten years ago and they're still locked up. And you know, it nothing but luck that it wasn't my platoon pulling the trigger. Marbeck can see where this is going, and he doesn't like

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Your point, please.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: We're killing off a whole planet here. And nobody has any idea. Seems like the kind of thing Congress would want to know about.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: (contemptuously) Congress? They bicker and compromise until even the best idea is watered down to nothing. A visionary is a man, not a mob. This Agency is the greatest center of learning on Earth. If I'm not fit to make this decision, who is?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I just want to know this job isn't going to come back to haunt me.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Captain, I've spent billions of dollars and decades of my life on this work. It's bigger than you. Be a soldier. Finish the job, and you'll be back in ranks in no time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance strides up to Scientist Larson at an intersection. old man grins and shakes Vance’s hand vigorously.  76.

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: Wonderful result, Conrad. Let’s go and see.

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNING COUNCIL CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Vance and the Scientists of the Governing Council surroun the holography table. Ada joins them. Vance catches her eye, but she looks away IN HOLOGRAM: The familiar blip of a Shadow emerges from t Prometheus Ground Station on Erix.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Shadow Fourteen. As the dim shape heads into the jungle, weapons fire flas around him - much brighter than before. The laser rifle etches lines of light across the landscape. A tremendous white flash. A plume of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Antimatter grenade.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Remarkable. Shadow Fourteen crosses Erix in a blaze of violence. He passes the death site of Shadow Thirteen and keeps going. The light flickers out far past any previous Shadow.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Nine days. Seventy-six kilometers. Shadow Fourteen stayed alive almost twice as long as any other Shadow.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Much more like it, Captain. (turning cold) Now finish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance sits at his holography table. A battle on Erix play itself out in front of him like a fireworks display. A fatality marker pops up: SHADOW 15.  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ada sits in what was Scientist Caul's office - now hers. She is looking at Scientist Caul's work: his equations, h diagrams...trying to understand. Lacking a cybernetic cro she must use a stylus and keyboard where Caul could use h mind alone. She browses a menu titled "SEMANTIC STUDIES." Selects a f An error message comes back: FILE DELETED. She tries the next file, and the next. The result is alwa the same: FILE DELETED. Ada paces around her office, scowling in troubled thought

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance bolts a new ID plate to the Staging Room wall. It r SHADOW 16. He steps back, looks at the array of names. Sixteen dead men. A movement catches his eye. He turns his head to find Ada watching him from the corridor, ghostly in her gray coat. When he catches her eye, she hurries away. VANCE’S QUARTERS - NIGHT Vance sits at his holography table. The map of Erix lies before him. He traces the paths of his Shadows...past the fatality markers of Shadows 16...17...18. Shadow 18 died just half a kilometer from Crawler Three. Vance stares thoughtfully at the map. Taps it with his stylus, zooming out. The outlines of continents and final the curvature of the planet become visible. He rotates the planet, studying it: rust-colored land, da rivers draining into darker seas...pale deserts, mountain ranges, polar icecaps. All wreathed in smoky clouds. The doorbell chimes. Vance switches the map back to his tactical view. Opens the door to find Ada.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: What if you get the repair done and go back to the Marines?  78.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Then I’1l be where I belong. (gently) But I’1l miss you.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I’ve been a coward. Marbeck told me to stay away from you, and I did. She steps into the room, and into his arms. Their kiss ga momentum fast. He presses her back onto the holography table, laying her body across the crags and valleys of Erix. The landscape crackles and sparks beneath her as he opens her gray coat VANCE’S QUARTERS - BEDROOM Vance and Ada lie entangled, sweat shining on their skin. pillows her head on Vance's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I think when you leave, I'm leaving too.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I'd have to apply to leave the project. But I think they'd have to let me out. Vance twists around to look her in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Where would you go?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I don't know. (shyly) Where will you be? Vance grins at her.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (teasing) Mars, probably. (her face falls, and he nuzzles her) But I'm overdue for some shore leave. Maybe I'll hang around Earth for a while.  79. She smiles in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Maybe you should.

dialogues.speaker: STAGING ROOM
dialogues.text: Vance pulls Ada down the stairs from his quarters. They'v thrown clothes on but they're still mussed from bed. Vanc looks mischievous; Ada wears a mystified smile.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Where are we going? Vance leads Ada to his empty armor. He holds his armor's remote control up to her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Say hello to Athena.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: (into remote) Hello, Athena. (to Vance) What's the idea?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I've been having Athena listen to you whenever you're around.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (takes the remote) Athena. System check. Athena speaks - and her voice sounds just like Ada now, w an electronic burr. ATHENA’S VOICE Power at one hundred percent. Sensor array online and nominal. No weapons rigged...

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: (in wonder) She sounds like me!

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Next time I go to Erix, I take you with me.  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance suits up for a transition to Erix. He wears the gleaming prototype weaponry. The badges on h helmet and shoulders read VANCE 19.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSPORT FACILITY
dialogues.text: Vance crosses the catwalk to the transport chamber. From Control Room, Director Marbeck watches him.

dialogues.speaker: MARBECK
dialogues.text: (over loudspeakers) Captain. Perhaps you’ll succeed this time.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Or die trying.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSPORT CHAMBER
dialogues.text: The chamber door closes, sealing Vance inside. Dynamos th and howl. A BOOM. Lightning strikes inside the tiny chamber. The chamber door opens, revealing:

dialogues.speaker: THE JUNGLE OF ERIX
dialogues.text: Reflected in Shadow Nineteen’s visor. His eyes widen in horror and astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: (in disbelief) Erix. I’m Shadow Nineteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance climbs out of his armor. Ada stands by him.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: How long will it be, do you think?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Shadow Eighteen lasted eleven days.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen stands in the open chamber, staring out a Erix. Like a sleepwalker he presses the door switch. The chamber closes. Seals him once more in a bright cocoo too small to move in. He closes his eyes. Swallows hard. Reaches for the door switch. Hesitates. Lets his hand fal He leans his head on the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t want to die. ATHENA’S VOICE Captain? It's Ada's voice. He’s still for a long moment, his eyes squeezed shut.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Nineteen. I’m Shadow Nineteen. Come on, Conrad. Be a Marine. He stands straight. Squares his shoulders. Opens the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battles of eighteen Shadows have transformed the terr A cratered field strewn with broken armor and alien bones ATHENA’S VOICE Satellite network acquired. On his visor, Athena marks the broken shapes of previous Shadows half-buried in the earth. ATHENA’S VOICE Marines down.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: I know, I know. The tracks beaten into the jungle by the Crawlers are narrower than before - overgrown. Shadow Nineteen steps out of the chamber. All around Prometheus, predators forage among the bones. ATHENA’S VOICE Multiple targets incoming.  82. Shadow Nineteen explodes into movement, running for high ground. Predators give chase. He strafes them with his laser rifle: CRACKLING BEAMS of white light. Predators fall dead. Trees topple in the jun It's a hell of a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen is on the run, hounded by SPIDERS that sl at him with curved blades. His armor shows damage: shallow notches and cuts. He's exhausted, panting, drenched in sweat. He turns and faces the spiders. Raises his grenade launch BOOM. BOOM. The antimatter explosions are blinding. Two blasts tear holes in the jungle, annihilating spiders But more keep coming...their numbers are incredible. ATHENA’S VOICE Targets inside minimum range.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: God damn. He strafes the nearest spiders with his rifle and runs. He splashes into a STREAM: the SPIDERS REAR BACK, HISSING and will not enter the liquid. Shadow Nineteen looks down. The stream is full of TRANSLU WORMS, big as rattlesnakes. They suck at his armor. He lifts a worm in his hand, experimentally. It bites harmlessly at his armor. After a moment he drops it. Spiders leap over his head to the opposite bank. They sla at him from both banks, nearly reaching him. He SUBMERGES HIMSELF in the stream. Under the surface, he watches the spiders search for him and straggle away. Shadow Nineteen’s breathing slows. He settles into a more comfortable position on the stream bottom. The eerie worm slide silently past, ignoring him.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Athena. Mission time. ATHENA’S VOICE Six hours, forty-nine minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m going to rest. Keep watch. If I sleep, wake me in ninety minutes. ATHENA’S VOICE Ninety minutes. Shadow Nineteen closes his eyes. INT. PROMETHEUS PROJECT - VANCE’S QUARTERS (EARTH) - NIG! Vance, sleeping in his narrow bed, wakes beside Ada. She caresses him, her bare arm gleaming in the half-light.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Can't stop thinking.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: The project. I'm a biologist, and somehow I ended up killing things for a living.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Don’t torture yourself about it. They launched Prometheus before you were born. A faraway look comes into Ada’s eyes. Her voice takes o: electronic tone.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Hazardous contact.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What? When she speaks again, her voice is clearly Athena's.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Critical strain on suit. Ada slides her arms around him. Her legs lock around his thigh. Her expression is inhuman, intense. She kisses hi violently - it’s the act of a predator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen slams awake in the alien waters. 83.

dialogues.speaker: HT
dialogues.text: nm an m  84. A SPINED SERPENT coils around him in a grotesque parody o Ada’s embrace. It bites at his visor, etching the glass. Shadow Nineteen, freeing his machete, hacks through the serpent’s coils. Worms swarm over the serpent’s corpse. Shadow Nineteen struggles out of the stream.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFFS
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen reaches the base of the cliffs. The body SHADOW TEN lies on the rocks, broken by a devastating fal He stands staring at the shattered body, haunted. Shakes it off. Looks up at the towering wall, a thousand meters of sheer rock.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF FACE
dialogues.text: He ascends in a series of climbs and rocket-assisted jump A STORM begins: fierce wind and a viscous black rain. He climbs on as darkness falls. Exhausted, he comes to a ledge in the cliff face where previous Shadows have burned their signatures into the ro SHADOW 7...SHADOW 11...SHADOW 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen wakes on the ledge. His eyes open on the awesome sight of the churning jungle far below. He’s about to resume climbing when he turns back, burns h name on the stone: SHADOW 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen climbs into view, panting, to find a...

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLAND PLAIN
dialogues.text: Covered with pale green waving grasses: serene and beauti Winged creatures wheel gracefully overhead. He pauses there and catches his breath: a moment of peace  85. Then he takes a step forward - and the GRASS itself clutc at him, scratching his armor. He leaps back, tearing hims loose. He spots a MESSAGE burned into the rocks: GRASS KILLS. BURN IT.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW 8
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen turns his flamethrower on the grass. It withdraws into the ground, baring a circle of earth that expands across the plain like ripples in a pond, revealin A litter of alien bones and a SUIT OF RAVAGED ARMOR whose plates read VANCE 6. Suddenly the grass sprouts anew. Doubling its height. Tripling it. The long blades beat at Shadow Nineteen. He flees along the cliffs.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY WASTE
dialogues.text: A wasteland of cracked clay studded with stone outcrops. Lightning flickers overhead. Shadow Nineteen crosses the waste at a run, his armor’s floodlights feeble in the vast darkness. He carries his r and grenade launcher. Breathing hard. Dripping sweat. ATHENA’S VOICE Bogeys incoming, five o'clock. Shadow Nineteen spins, fires a grenade high. It EXPLODES, white sunburst. Winged creatures fall away in flames. For a moment the wasteland is illuminated. Strange shapes moving closer through the darkness. ATHENA’S VOICE Seven grenades remaining. Shadow Nineteen runs on. Passing a rock formation, he sli into a long, skidding stop. Turns his light on the rock. A message is burned above a crevice: SHELTER. ATHENA’S VOICE Bogeys incoming, eight o’clock. Ten o'clock. Four o’clock... Shadow Nineteen scrambles for the crevice.  86.

dialogues.speaker: CAVE UNDER THE ROCK
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen squirms inside: a tight fit. Turning to survey the tiny cave, Shadow Nineteen gasps in shock: a DEAD MARINE sits in his floodlight beams. The ID tags on the battered armor read VANCE 9. Shadow Nine’s eyes stare through a broken visor. Vermin scuttle inside his helmet. Dried blood paints the cave fl O.S. A SCRABBLING NOISE. Something outside tries to get in. Scimitar CLAWS probe t cave entrance and withdraw. Shadow Nineteen sits, keeping his rifle on the cave mouth eyeing Shadow Nine. The corpse stares back.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EARTH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance, sitting alone in the Council Chamber, studies a ma Erix in the big hologram table. Scientist Larson joins hi Peers at the map: Shadow Eighteen’s death marker flashes.

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: Eighteen got close. Nineteen’s there now?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Almost a week.

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: Long time to spend fighting.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Men have fought longer...but not like this. Larson looks conflicted. Finally he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: You asked me once how we kept Prometheus a secret.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (suddenly alert) That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Prometheus was complete, the Design Committee came back to Earth on a shuttle. The construction crew followed on a transport ship. Vance picks up on Larson's grim tone.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: We lost contact with the transport. It missed turnaround and shot past Earth. Fell into the sun with three thousand souls.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: My God. (he stares at Larson) You think that was no accident.

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: It kept our secret very well. Vance takes that in grimly.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me this now?

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: You're close to succeeding. When you do, you'll no longer be useful. You'll be in danger. I'm worried about Ada, too. She's repeating Martin's research. If she finds what he found, she could be removed as well. Vance is starting to take this seriously.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: "Removed?"

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: Martin was officially "reassigned." But he's no longer listed in the SSA directory, and his phone number doesn't work. Most likely he's ina cell somewhere. He may be dead. (off Vance's stare) Do you understand now where you are? What kind of place? 87.  88.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What did Martin Caul find?

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: He didn't tell me. And now I can’t ask him.

dialogues.speaker: CAVE UNDER THE ROCK
dialogues.text: Still leaning against the cave wall, Shadow Nineteen slee He’s turned his armor’s floodlights off: only dim instrum lights illuminate his face. A SCRAPE of metal. Movement in the darkness. An armored h slides up Shadow Nineteen’s chest. He wakes with a start. SHADOW NINE leans over him, dead eyes leering, mouth agap clutching at his armor. Their faces are inches apart. Sha Nineteen is paralyzed by terror. The dead man breathes raggedly. Wheezing, gripped by a hideous need to communicate. He speaks in a ruined voice.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINE
dialogues.text: This world will kill you, and you will kill the world.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: (a desperate whisper) I'm not going to die here.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINE
dialogues.text: You are a circle of death.

dialogues.speaker: CAVE UNDER THE ROCK
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen wakes with a shout. His armor’s floodligh snap on. His rifle whips up, aims at Shadow Nine. Shaking Shadow Nine slumps against the wall, lifeless and inert.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Athena. Has that guy moved? ATHENA’S VOICE No, Captain. That guy is dead.  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen stalks at high alert through the undergro He is gaunt, weary, whiskered. His armor carries new scar His battle-suit motors grind and whine.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Athena. Mission time. ATHENA’S VOICE Six days, fifteen hours.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Stimulant. ATHENA’S VOICE You have exceeded recommended dosages...

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Override. There’s a HISS. His pupils dilate sharply. He takes a rag breath and stands up straighter.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLAND MAZE
dialogues.text: The red sun beats down on a valley of fissured stone. The report of Shadow Nineteen’s rifle echoes distantly. F off a flock of WINGED RAPTORS bursts into the air, scream A sudden EXPLOSION as an antimatter grenade detonates in distance. Stones wheel airborne through the smoke. Anothe BLAST. And ANOTHER. Shadow Nineteen, barely seen, works his way through the r maze, his movement betrayed by a trail of smoke and ruin. An explosion resounds. The echoes reverberate and fade, a silence falls on the valley.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY HOLLOW
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen, moving stealthily, rounds a rock outcrop disturbs a giant WORM feeding on its kill. An armored Worm, with no eyes and a complex mouth full of blades. Its blind head whips around, questing. Shadow Nineteen freezes.  90. The Worm doesn’t budge. A long moment passes. Shadow Nine takes a slow step toward the shelter of the rock outcrop. Worm slithers toward him - frighteningly fast.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Oh, hell. He raises the grenade launcher. ATHENA’S VOICE Too close. Shadow Nineteen fires PAST the Worm. The grenade arcs ove its head and DESTROYS its kill in a grotesque explosion. ATHENA’S VOICE Grenades depleted. The blast batters the Worm, but it gathers itself at once Sniffs at the ruin of its dinner. Charges Shadow Nineteen Shadow Nineteen drops the empty grenade launcher and shoulders his rifle: Fires. Hits the Worm twice, inflicting terrible wounds, but it doesn’t slow down. Its jaws close on the rifle: the rifle CRACKS loudly. Spe white plasma. The Worm, scorched, leaps back SCREAMING: a hideous, unearthly sound. Shadow Nineteen hastily flings the rifle away. It spins through the air and EXPLODES in a sunburst of white light Shadow Nineteen turns to face the Worm, drawing his mache too late. The Worm SLAMS into him. They tumble over the ground, grappling. The machete goes flying. With his armored hands, Shadow Nineteen strains to preven the Worm's mandibles from closing on him. Pinned under the Worm, Shadow Nineteen plants his feet against its body and fires his JUMP JETS. Flames ROAR fro his boots. The Worm recoils, shrieking. Shadow Nineteen rolls to his feet. Unarmed, howling in rage, he meets the Worm head-on and d BLOW after BLOW with his armored fists until black blood coats his gauntlets and the Worm lies slain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen stands combing through data, scanning map  91.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Athena. Show me the bodies of other Shadows. I need a weapon. In Shadow Nineteen’s visor, glowing markers spring up acr the landscape, each marking the death-site of a Shadow.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Who’s closest? ATHENA’S VOICE Shadow Thirteen. A single death marker shines in the highlands. Beside it, distance indicator reads 3.6 KILOMETERS. SHADOW THIRTEEN’S LAST STAND Shadow Nineteen sneaks up on the site. He holds his machete in one hand. His flamethrower nozzle juts from his other wrist - his only remaining weapons.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Athena. Stimulant. A HISS. He shudders and steps out into the open. In a clearing, SHADOW THIRTEEN lies slumped against a sto His body bristles with spines sunk deep in his armor. Around him lie hundreds of alien corpses: spiny Scorpions dead and broken. They crunch under Shadow Nineteen’s feet Shadow Thirteen’s armor and rifle are covered with strang crystals. Shielding his head, Shadow Nineteen test-fires corroded weapon. It EXPLODES in his hand. Shadow Nineteen screams in frustration. ATHENA’S VOICE Damage to right glove. Repairing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen, crossing hard dried clay and sparse plan life, warily approaches a huddled shape. His visor displa labels the shape: SHADOW 15. As he gets closer, Shadow Nineteen discerns a fantastic sight: a MENAGERIE OF ALIEN CREATURES sitting around a hi light. Most appear dead. A few breathe but do not move.  92. Still closer. He sees an ARMORED MARINE squatting among t beasts: SHADOW FIFTEEN. A rifle discarded at his feet. Thin NEEDLE TENDRILS have emerged from the ground at Shad Fifteen’s feet, crept up his legs, and found entrance thr his armor’s chestplate. A skull stares out of the helmet. All the creatures are snared and pierced by these tendril Shadow Nineteen shields his eyes from the light. He grope toward the fallen rifle. Getting close, he glances up at the dead marine - and see LIGHT reflected in the dead man’s visor. Entranced by the reflection, he lowers his hand. A BRIGHT light tugs at the corner of his eye, and he looks at the source. A BEAUTIFUL GLOWING ORB atop a vegetable stalk. Shadow Nineteen approaches it. Steps into the ring of creatures, staring, hypnotized. He drops into a crouch, just like Shadow Fifteen. Fine ne tips grow from the soil around his boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen hasn’t moved. ATHENA’S VOICE Captain. You’re dehydrated. His drinking tube nudges his lips inside his helmet. Shad Nineteen doesn’t drink. Water drips down his chin.

dialogues.speaker: ATHENA
dialogues.text: You are suffering muscle cramps, Captain. Injecting muscle relaxant. A hiss. His lips move, faintly, but he doesn’t speak. He stares into the light. Fine tendrils wind around Shadow Nineteen’s legs and ques upward. Their needle-tips search for weak points. Across from Shadow Nineteen, an alien corpse collapses, gutted by vampiric tendrils. And over the alien corpse... ..-an impossible APPARITION stands:  93. A black-cloaked figure - as if the Angel of Death itself come to watch Shadow Nineteen die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ada and Vance stand huddled against the wind in the corne the roof. They wear overcoats: winter has come to New Washington.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Three thousand dead!

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: That's what Larson said. The whole construction crew. Ada's outrage hardens into determination.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I'm going to find out what Martin discovered.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I don't think that's smart.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. I need to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen crouches in the ring of aliens. His lips cracked, his eyes bloodshot. He breathes in shallow gasps There is no sign of the mysterious cloaked figure who sto watching before. ATHENA’S VOICE Captain. You must wake up. Captain. Captain Vance. Injecting stimulant. A HISS. Shadow Nineteen’s pupils dilate. His breath catch but resumes its shallow rhythm. ATHENA’S VOICE Captain...You must... Athena trails off - as if even she is surrendering hope. The tendrils entangling Shadow Nineteen grope at the chestplate of his armor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly SHADOW FIFTEEN collapses: the tendrils have stri his skeleton and gutted his armor. He falls apart with a horrible CLATTER of metal and bone. Shadow Nineteen’s eyes flicker to the fallen figure. He r his own name on the armor. A precious moment of lucidity.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: (huskily) Athena. Blackout. His visor goes OPAQUE. Shadow Nineteen falls to the groun Slowly tears free of the tendrils, his limbs in agony.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Athena, you see the light?

dialogues.speaker: ATHENA
dialogues.text: Yes, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Don’t let me see that light. Tell me when I’m facing away. He turns on hands and knees.

dialogues.speaker: ATHENA
dialogues.text: The light is behind you now. Shadow Nineteen crawls a few feet, attempts to get to his feet. He’s too weak.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Help me stand up. His armor’s motors whine. Mechanically, like a puppet, Sh Nineteen stands.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Let’s walk. Shadow Nineteen trudges away, his steps stiff and robotic

dialogues.speaker: ROCK OUTCROP
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen sits shaking in the shelter of stones.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Food. Water. An arm inside his helmet presses a food pellet to his lip He eats it. His water tube extends, and he drinks.  95.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Stimulant. ATHENA’S VOICE It’s dangerous to...

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Override. Stimulant. HISS. Shadow Nineteen gulps air. His teeth chatter.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Show me the next Shadow’s location. I need a weapon. A pointer appears on his visor display: the distance indicator reads 14.1 KILOMETERS. ATHENA’S VOICE Shadow Fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHLAND JUNGLE
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen, still shaky, prowls into a stand of tree He carries his machete and flamethrower at the ready - th only weapons he has left.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Stimulant. ATHENA’S VOICE You have no more combat stimulant. He almost bursts into tears. An ALIEN WOLF lunges from the woods in front of him. Shad Nineteen chases it off with a billow of flame. ATHENA’S VOICE Flamethrower fuel low. More wolves approach behind him. Shadow Nineteen throws f their way. They keep their distance. Shadow Nineteen fights a retreating action through the wo keeping the pursuing wolf-pack at bay with his flamethrow He backs into a...

dialogues.speaker: CLEARING
dialogues.text: The wolf-pack stops in its tracks, wailing and keening.  96. Shadow Nineteen turns. A giant THORN TREE towers here, it bladed branches filled with skewered creatures. Among the monsters, crucified on thorns, hangs an ARMORED MARINE. ATHENA’S VOICE Shadow Fourteen. SHADOW FOURTEEN’S rifle is still in his hand. Shadow Nineteen steps warily forward. Branches slash at h He fends them off with the machete and steps back, pantin He aims his flamethrower and tries to burn the tree. Fire licks weakly from the nozzle and flickers out. ATHENA’S VOICE Flamethrower fuel depleted. The wolf-pack mills at the edge of the clearing, watching Shadow Nineteen tries to reach Shadow Fourteen by hacking slashing with the machete. The branches are too many and strong. He retreats, his armor gashed and sparking. No gun. No flamethrower. He needs a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Athena. What’s the power reading on Shadow Fourteen’s armor? ATHENA’S VOICE Power at eighty-seven percent.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: What’s my power cell reading? ATHENA’S VOICE Eighty-nine percent.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: If I pull my power cell, how long will my backup power last? ATHENA’S VOICE Thirty seconds. He stares at Shadow Fourteen’s body, gauging distances.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: When I pull my power cell, give me a countdown to power out. ATHENA’S VOICE Warning: when backup power...  97.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: No warnings. Just count down. He pulls the power cell from its slot in his chest. Red warning lights flash on. ATHENA’S VOICE Thirty seconds of power remaining. Shadow Nineteen squeezes the power cell in his hands unti CRACKS. White light shines from the fissure. He hurls the leaking cell into the heart of the tree.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Come on... The cell EXPLODES. The tree, engulfed in flame, flails an screams. Shadow Nineteen shrinks away from the deadly lim ATHENA’S VOICE Twenty seconds remaining. The tree’s thrashing weakens. Shadow Nineteen wades into branches, hacking with the machete. The dying tree rakes at his armor. Shadow Nineteen grabs Shadow Fourteen’s ankle. Drags the body down. ATHENA’S VOICE Ten seconds remaining. Shadow Nineteen pulls the dead man’s POWER CELL - as a BR lifts him off his feet. The power cell falls to the groun He fights desperately, chopping with his massive machete. ATHENA’S VOICE Five seconds. Shadow Nineteen hacks through the branch. FALLS heavily t the ground. He searches frantically for the power cell. ATHENA’S VOICE Four...three... He sees it! Lunges though the burning branches. ATHENA’S VOICE Two...one... His hand closes around the power cell - just as his power dies. He crashes to the ground, his armor suddenly a crus iron maiden he cannot lift.  98. The outside world is muffled, his breathing loud in his o ears. His breath fogs his visor. Shadow Nineteen roars in frustration inside his helmet. The WOLF-PACK pushes into the branches. Screaming with effort, Shadow Nineteen rolls onto his bac An ALIEN WOLF sniffs at his helmet, drooling onto the gla Shadow Nineteen’s right arm fights the weight of his armo Pushes the power cell toward the slot in his chestplate. The wolf gnaws at Shadow Nineteen’s armored throat. Involuntarily, Shadow Nineteen turns his face away from t horrible jaws. A stunning sight greets him: ...the APPARITION has returned. The CLOAKED FIGURE stands outside the tree, watching him. this time Shadow Nineteen sees it. For a split second he stares in astonishment. Then he clo his eyes. Clenches his teeth in concentration: The power cell skids toward the slot...misses...hangs...a SLIDES HOME. His armor HUMS BACK TO LIFE. He reaches up. Takes the wol head in his hands and twists. There’s a horrible CRACK, a it falls limp. Shadow Nineteen seizes Shadow Fourteen’s rifle and rakes wolf-pack with energy bolts. They scatter into the jungle He looks around. No sign of the cloaked figure he glimpse during his struggle. Quickly he scavenges Shadow Fourteen’s jump-jet fuel... ammunition...food pellets...water and oxygen tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen enters an orchard of GLOWING TREES. Insec flutter around them, feeding and hunting one another. The scene is beautiful and calm. Shadow Nineteen looks ar cautiously, his rifle sweeping with his eyes. Nothing dangerous appears. He sits against a rock in the middle of the clearing, watching the dancing lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ada leads Vance through a dimly lit storage facility. The pass a tall rack of massive glassy discs. They speak in undertones.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What are these?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Prometheus uses the Transporter to send copies of its memory home. That's how we get data from Erix. We're looking for smaller ones... here. A second rack of glassy discs seems to extend for miles.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Backups of the core computer. She drifts down the rack, scanning serial numbers. Stops.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: This is the one. I thought it might not be here. FOOTSTEPS down the aisle. Vance pulls Ada around the corner, behind a rack of shelv They hold their breaths. An ARCHIVIST passes, yawning. When he's gone they emerge again. Ada takes the data disc the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: The files Martin worked on in his last days here were all deleted. But the files should still be here on the backups. It's holographic storage - impossible to edit.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: So how do we read it without setting off any alarms?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: We need a mainframe that's not connected to the network. And I know where to find one.  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaning against the rock, Shadow Nineteen wakes. The inse are gone. The trees have withdrawn their luminous fronds. He rises and stretches, showing some of his former vigor. Burns a message on the rock he slept against: SAFE.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFFS
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen reaches the clifftop: a sweeping vista of jungle below. For the first time he sees CRAWLER THREE. His visor magnifies the image: a metal monstrosity squatt in the jungle. Winged creatures circle it like crows. His visor gives the distance: 18.1 KILOMETERS.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF FACE
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen climbs down. Losing his grip, he slides d a sheer face. Fires his jets. Lands safely on a lower led ATHENA’S VOICE Jump jet fuel low.

dialogues.speaker: LOWLAND JUNGLE
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen runs through the wilderness, rifle raised TENTACLE reaches down from the jungle canopy. He SEVERS i with a blast of gunfire and runs on. A massive ANIMAL rears up in his path. He guns it down without waiting to see its intentions. Runs on.

dialogues.speaker: THE GREEN ROAD
dialogues.text: Lungs heaving, Shadow Nineteen stumbles out of the jungle into the wide track left by Crawler Three. In the beaten track, GREEN EARTH-LIFE GROWS, a mossy high through the alien forest. Nothing moves on the green road follows the trail toward the Crawler in peace. He passes alien creatures dead at the green road's edge, their skins overgrown with green patches like a plague.  101.

dialogues.speaker: THE GREEN ROAD
dialogues.text: Cresting a rise, Shadow Nineteen sees CRAWLER THREE, two kilometers away. The giant machine is frozen in its track halfway up a hill.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Athena. Display last locations of Shadows Seventeen and Eighteen. His visor displays two MARKERS on the road in front of hi

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: (musing) Something between here and there. GREEN ROAD - SITE OF SHADOW SEVENTEEN’S DEATH Shadow Nineteen, at high alert, approaches the spot where Shadow Seventeen’s death marker hovers in his visor displ There’s nothing to see on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Seventeen died here. Athena, scan for hardware. ATHENA’S VOICE No hardware detected. Shadow Nineteen looks around, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Where'd he go? GREEN ROAD - SITE OF SHADOW EIGHTEEN’S DEATH Following the green road, Shadow Nineteen makes an astonishing discovery: A line of poles marches across the landscape. Mounted ato the poles are the skulls of various bizarre creatures. Th skulls are inscribed with symbols and alien characters. Where the green road crosses this border, several poles l crushed and flattened in Crawler Three's tracks. Shadow Nineteen inspects one of the skulls, but can make sense of the writing there. His eyes are wide with astonishment and confusion. Breathing hard, he walks across the border.  102. ATHENA’S VOICE Marines down. A marker appears on his visor display. Shadow Nineteen approaches a dark shape on the ground. Side by side, SHADOW SEVENTEEN and SHADOW EIGHTEEN lie de in the green muck. Arms and legs outstretched. Their weap lie beside them, broken to pieces. The dead men’s armor is riddled with neat TRIANGULAR PUNCTURES. Bare skulls inside the helmets. ATHENA’S VOICE Target, twelve-o’clock. He looks up. A BLACK-CLOAKED FIGURE stands in the green r Barring his way. Shadow Nineteen freezes in terror. It’s impossible sight.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: (with superstitious dread) Who’s there? The Cloaked Figure cocks its head at him. With its foot - hidden under its cloak - it draws a LINE across the groun

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: What are you? It SPEAKS. A guttural clatter of sound. Shadow Nineteen stares. At the line in the earth. At the figure. He POINTS down the green road toward Crawler Thre

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: I’m going to the Crawler. I'm going past you. The Cloaked Figure trembles. Speaks again: inhuman sounds redraws its line in the earth, cutting a deeper furrow. Shadow Nineteen taps his own chest and points down the ro And the cloaked figure OPENS ITS WINGS: revealing a PREYI MANTIS shape with sickled limbs. It's an alien being, not supernatural one. Its slim body is armored in metallic scales. Its claws ar adorned with ornaments of twisted wire, glinting with jew Its large eyes are strangely beautiful: iridescent like o colors playing across them.  103. The Mantis raises its arms and beats the air - as if to s stay back. With a gasp, Shadow Nineteen raises his gun, his hands shaking. The Mantis takes flight, too fast to hit. It lands beside the road. Furls its wings. Once more take the appearance of a cloaked figure: a cosmic coincidence. It CHITTERS. From its cowl a TRIANGULAR TUSK juts and withdraws. Shadow Nineteen glances at the triangular punctures in th armor of Shadow Seventeen and Shadow Eighteen. He RUNS toward Crawler Three. The Mantis pursues him. ATHENA’S VOICE Incoming, six-o’clock. Shadow Nineteen spins and fires. The Mantis veers away. ATHENA’S VOICE Incoming. Shadow Nineteen bounds off the ground on his jump jets. T Mantis barely misses him. He fires mid-air. It spirals ar him, impossible to hit. He lands and runs on. He reaches Crawler Three. ROCKETS up the side of the Craw ATHENA’S VOICE Incoming, five-o’clock. He twists in the air, firing. And his jets SPUTTER OUT. Straining for the top of the Crawler, Shadow Nineteen fal short. Clings with one hand to the Crawler’s side. ATHENA’S VOICE Jet fuel depleted. He slaps his rifle into its clamps. With both hands, he climbs desperately. The Mantis is shouting at him - strange syllables carried the wind.  104.

dialogues.speaker: ATOP THE CRAWLER
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen reaches the top. Scrambles onto the deck. The top of the Crawler is covered with alien writing: unreadable pictograms scratched into the armor plate. Shadow Nineteen has no time to take this ATHENA’S VOICE Incoming. Shadow Nineteen spins to face the Mantis. Too late. He dr his machete - - but the Mantis SLAMS INTO HIM like a living missile, an the machete clatters away. They struggle. The Mantis locks its barbed legs around him. THRUSTS its through his helmet into his neck. Shadow Nineteen SCREAMS. Pushes at the thin powerful body Slowly he forces the tusk out of his neck. Blood spatters visor from the inside. Unable to free himself from the Mantis's serrated arms, Shadow Nineteen locks his arms around the creature's thin powerful body - and SQUEEZES with all his might. His armor's motor's WHINE. There is a ghastly CRACK, and Mantis falls dead. Shadow Nineteen struggles to his knees, choking on blood. He swings his helmet back in the toxic atmosphere. Slaps field bandage on his neck. Applies an emergency patch to helmet. He puts his helmet back on.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Purge. Jets of white gas HISS from the suit. Wind whips his hair inside the helmet. Shadow Nineteen inhales greedily. For the first time he sees the writing on the Crawler. He stares with bloodshot eyes and can't make sense of it. The beetle-like communications module looms above him.  105. Instead of the ragged tear from the mock-up on Earth, the armored dome carries a row of triangular punctures, surrounded by hex signs and inscriptions. The Mantis's wo He pulls back the punctured dome to reveal the familiar repair job. ATHENA’S VOICE Multiple targets incoming. He turns. Winged MANTISES are circling: ragged black phantoms again the fiery sky. Three of them land atop the Crawler. They shout at him in their strange tongue: jarring sounds. Shadow Nineteen snatches up his fallen machete. Brandishe the blade.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: (hoarsely) Get away from me! His amplified voice thunders. The aliens stand their grou They flicker closer. Shadow Nineteen sees the Mantises are standing atop the h covers of the Crawler’s MISSILE WELLS. He gestures: his toolkit extends from his armor. Turning back on the Angels, he begins the repair.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Athena. Running range to nearest target. ATHENA’S VOICE Four meters. Shadow Nineteen works feverishly. Panting. His hands shak ATHENA’S VOICE Three meters. He clenches his hands, shakes them loose. Keeps working. ATHENA’S VOICE Two meters. One meter. Contact. He pulls his machete and slashes behind him. Mantises bur away from him like a flock of crows - and dive back, claw raking at him.  106. With one hand he hacks and slashes at the aliens, keeping them at bay. With the other he works at the repair. Sparks fly from his battered armor. His blade, streaked w black blood, never stops slashing. He COMPLETES THE REPAIR. Crawler Three RUMBLES INTO MOTION, resuming its slow craw the hill. Trees sway and topple under its treads. The Mantises SCREAM in protest. The hatch-covers of the missile wells SLAM open. FOUR GIA ROCKETS LAUNCH, immersing the Crawler in fire. The Mantises shrivel and burn. Shadow Nineteen curls into ball, his armor bathed in flame. When the fire passes, Sh Nineteen remains, smoking but safe in his blackened armor He rises shakily. Watches the rockets arc away across the in four different directions. A pall of smoke hangs over the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark cavernous space filled with mothballed equipment. Ada pulls a dust-cover off a massive computer. Vance stan beside her, a coiled power cord slung over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: This is the old bio-simulator. Too valuable to throw away, too classified to let anyone use it. There's power over there. Vance plugs the machine in. Ada inserts the disc, taps at terminal. In a moment the display fills with light. Ada navigates a dense directory: thousands of files.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: In his last days here, Martin did almost all of his work in this program. "Semantic Survey 3.1". She touches controls. IN HOLOGRAM: The globe of Erix appears. The view shifts f one spot on the planet to another. Sparks of light swarm the surface in rapidly changing patterns.  107. Graphs and data readouts surround the planet.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: (fascinated) It's a program based on the work I did for you. But much more sophisticated. See, if you watch animals move around long enough, you can figure out how much information they’re exchanging. You watch fish swim in a school, they do a small amount of coordination. You watch a beehive, and you can tell the bees have a crude language. Then you watch people move around a city, and over time their movement implies complex language. Higher intelligence. Ada sorts through species rapidly. Each one has a differe fingerprint on the planet’s surface - different readings the semantic indexes: all low numbers. Suddenly the numbers jump, high up the scale. The new movement pattern on Erix is stunning: a complex web of li embracing the whole planet. Ada gasps in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: This is what Martin Caul found. Species 8429.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: They talk?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: This is high-order language. This is a civilization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crests the hilltop, tree-trunks snapping like cannon shot The smoke clears. Trees fall away. Atop the Crawler, Shadow Nineteen looks down in shock at.

dialogues.speaker: A MANTIS CITY
dialogues.text: Under the jungle canopy, twisted TOWERS of dark plaster r out of the ground like smokestacks. Irregular windows glo with a pale red light.  108. TUNNELS snake between the towers: a maze on the forest fl An organic city. A hive. Mantises look out from the towers. Hooded figures row on They wheel and soar over the city: darting into tunnels, erupting from the towers' mouths. The Crawler churns down the hill toward the city. Huge tr topple under its treads. Branches scrape at Shadow Nineteen as the Crawler descend among the towering trees. Alien inscriptions cover the mammoth trunks. A BARRICADE surrounds the Mantis city - a spiky thicket o alien teeth and bones. The Crawler GRINDS OVER THE BARRICADE. A great lamentation rises from the city: A cacophony of shrieks and beating wings. Mantises swarm from the city and fling themselves at Craw Three. By the hundreds they STRAIN to hold the Crawler back with strength of their bodies - and the Crawler drives them ba and crushes them under its treads. Shadow Nineteen looks down in horror.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: What am I doing? (shouting) Athena! Guidance control. Stop the Crawler! Stop it now! He looks up. The rockets’ contrails arch away across the the rockets hurtling toward the horizon. Shadow Nineteen scrambles to the top of the comm module. lifts his rifle and sights on a rocket. SHADOW NINETEEN’S POV: A targeting reticle appears over t rocket in his visor display. Range, velocity, windage. He FIRES. And AGAIN. And AGAIN. A moment passes. The rocket EXPLODES in a distant firebal He sights on another rocket and fires three rounds. It DETONATES: the fireball hangs in the sky.  109. He aims at a third rocket...too late. The remaining two rockets have vanished over the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Damn it! With a vast SIGH of machinery, the Crawler stops. Silence falls on the forest. A ROAR OF WINGS. Mantises rise from the city like a cyclo They fill the branches - thousands of watching figures. A Mantis shouts from within the city. The haunting cry ec eerily among the silent towers. Another voice joins the outcry, and another. Soon a thousand voices are raised in tumult. A riot of so

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: (shaken) Athena. Show me navigation. We're turning this thing around.

dialogues.speaker: PROMETHEUS GROUND STATION
dialogues.text: Prometheus’s antennas pivot to receive a message. A BOOM like a thunderclap inside the giant ship. Lightnin stabs upward into the turbulent clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monitors light up. Electricity dances over the Transporte Scientist Banneker looks up from his instruments.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Transmission! He strides to the terminal, scans the data.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: The repair’s complete! Crawler Three is running. Launch is success... (horror replaces the elation in his face) Oh, no. No!

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Vance and Ada hurry along, talking in whispers, agitated.  110.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: This is first contact. We've found an alien civilization - and we're slaughtering them. We're poisoning their world. If we don't stop this, we're going to regret it forever.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: We'll go for my armor. Once I'm wearing it, nobody can stop me. And then I'll get us out of here. As they approach the Staging Room, Vance quickens his ste

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: We can't let this happen. I have to let someone...

dialogues.speaker: STAGING ROOM
dialogues.text: Full of guards.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: ...know. The guards' pistols come Across the Staging Room, sight on an elevator. He up. Vance and Ada freeze. Vance's armor locker sinks out of watches it go in dismay. The guards part to let Director Marbeck and Banneker thro Marbeck’s face is a mask of rage.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen has repaired Crawler Three.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: So what’s with all...

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: He sabotaged the mission. Half the rockets destroyed!

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: He did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don’t play the innocent with me. You did this. This monstrous thing. (to Banneker) Lock him up. 111. The guards seize Vance and drag him out under Banneker's gloating eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: (to Ada) And you. Did you help to plan this?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: (bitterly) I wish I had. Where's Martin Caul?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: His heart failed him. But your heart mustn't fail. The ocean program has lost two rockets. I need your expertise to compensate for the damage. The terraforming effort depends on it.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: The terraforming effort has to stop. You know what Martin found.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: It's time you took the crown, Ada. It may help you see things clearly.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: No. Director Marbeck beckons to his guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards shove Vance into an empty steel-walled room. Turni back, Vance confronts Banneker in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: I hope you enjoyed your conspiracy. It’ll be the end of you. And Ada will face her own consequences.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What consequences? Banneker removes his cap. His cybernetic crown gleams.  112.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: As we speak, she’s becoming one of us at last.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: The hell she is. Banneker smiles. The door begins to close. Like lightning, Vance reaches out, grabs Banneker’s coat. Yanks the Scientist into the sliding door’s path. The doo bounces open again. Vance charges out. Hammers Banneker into the wall. Bannek drops, limp. Three guards in the hallway draw their pistols hastily. Vance is a demon among them. A quick flurry of blows and close-quarters gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
