dialogues.text: A sterile facility: white enamel and cold steel. Ada lies strapped into a terrifying apparatus: a CORONATI MACHINE. She wears a flimsy hospital gown. Her head is secured in a metal clamp. Above her hangs the cybernetic crown she will soon wear forever. She twists at her restraints in vain. An old PHYSICIAN in scarlet coat begins to shave her head.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Please don’t do this. Please don’t do this. The Physician winces but stays the course. Ada’s beautifu locks drop to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: PHYSICIAN
dialogues.text: Shhh. A sudden COMMOTION. An Agency Guard staggers into the room, slams into the wa and collapses. Vance charges in. He rushes to Ada. Shoving the Physician aside, he works a the straps that hold her down.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Ada. I’m here. It’s all right.  113.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Conrad! Oh, hurry. Look out! The old Physician presses an instrument to Vance’s neck. HISSES. Vance jumps as if bitten.

dialogues.speaker: PHYSICIAN
dialogues.text: You’1l be no more trouble. Vance knocks the Physician out with one punch. But alread looks woozy. Vance’s legs buckle. He drops to his knees, fumbling at A restraints. His face is inches from hers.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Stay awake. Conrad. Please...

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Ada... He collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prometheus towers over the jungle. A deep rumble. Foliage crashes down. Crawler Three rolls into the clearing. It churns to a stop beside its mother ship.

dialogues.speaker: ATOP THE CRAWLER
dialogues.text: Armor plates have been warped into a crude bunker. The we metal tears open. Shadow Nineteen climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transporter’s massive door rumbles open to reveal the small bright chamber. Shadow Nineteen steps in.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Athena. Overlay tech specs. In his visor’s heads-up display, a wireframe circuit diag is superimposed on the chamber walls. He opens a panel, revealing complex controls.  114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scientist Banneker talks to grey-coated technicians in th vast transporter cavern. Suddenly, electricity CRACKLES over the transporter. Klax howl. The technicians flee. Banneker stands his ground. A resounding BOOM. The transport chamber opens. Shadow Nineteen steps out. H rifle rests in its clamps on his thigh.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Vance! Shadow Nineteen opens his visor, breathes clean air. He approaches Banneker across the catwalk.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: I had to come back. Banneker concentrates. The catwalk withdraws, separating Shadow Nineteen and Banneker from the Transporter. The he steel doors of the Transport Facility slam shut.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Listen to me. Banneker sweeps the room with furious eyes. In unison, fo security cannons aim at Shadow Nineteen.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: (shouting) Wait! The cannons FIRE. Bullets tear at him, throwing showers of sparks from his armor, leaving gouges in the metal. His visor slams shut. Staggering under the onslaught, he pulls his rifle and fi destroying one cannon. Another. Banneker flees. The Staging Room door opens for him. Shadow Nineteen pounds after him.

dialogues.speaker: STAGING ROOM
dialogues.text: Banneker glances at the Staging Room door. It slams shut.  115. Shadow Nineteen slides into the closing door. The steel s pins him against the frame. On the far side, the security cannons rake at his armor, throwing sparks. He strains. The door grinds back. He slides through. Banneker gestures. Two security cannons drop from the Sta Room ceiling. Shadow Nineteen blasts them into shrapnel. Banneker is caught in the open, at gunpoint. He freezes.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: There are cities on Erix. It's inhabited. Banneker rolls his eyes in contempt.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: Not for long.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: (astounded) You knew!

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: You idiot. A FLOOR HATCH opens beside Shadow Nineteen. The floor ben him slam into motion - it's a conveyor belt - and flings into the pit. As Shadow Nineteen climbs out, the hatch cover closes on clamping him in place. Banneker gloats nearby - until Shadow Nineteen's rifle sw that way. A PLATFORM rises between them: Shadow Nineteen's rifle fi tears into the platform as Banneker ducks for cover. Shadow Nineteen wrenches himself free of the floor hatch. Racing around the platform, he draws a bead on Banneker.. But the Staging Room CRANE swoops out of the shadows. Sei him in its claw, pinning his gun arm to his side. ATHENA’S VOICE Critical strains on suit. Unable to break free, Shadow Nineteen sees heavy bolts on hinge of the claw. With his free arm he extrudes his tool Banneker grins wickedly. The heavy crane smashes Shadow Nineteen against the wall. Shadow Nineteen works desperat  116. A bolt spins out of the crane’s hinge. One finger of the falls off, freeing Shadow Nineteen’s gun hand. He shoots the crane’s hydraulics, and the metal arm goes limp. Freed, Shadow Nineteen lands on his feet. A FREIGHT PLATFORM tips, burying him in massive metal cra Banneker smiles in triumph...but Shadow Nineteen rises fr the wreckage, a crate held overhead. He HURLS the crate a Banneker with a roar of animal rage. The crate crushes Banneker against the wall. The room falls silent. Shadow Nineteen rolls the heavy crate away from Banneker’ body. Banneker, broken and dying, gasps for air.

dialogues.speaker: BANNEKER
dialogues.text: (a whisper) You’re not even supposed to exist. Banneker’s breath stops. His eyes stare at nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: But I do. He turns, makes his way painfully across the room. His armor's motors whine as he moves.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Athena. Mayday beacon. ATHENA’S VOICE Mayday beacon on. A red light begins to flash on his armor's chestplate.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Scientist Larson looks up in alarm as red emergency light begin to flash all along the hallway. The security cannon at the corner EXPLODES. Larson cringe Shadow Nineteen steps out of the smoke in his battered ar He recognizes Larson and his rage subsides.

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: Conrad! How did you... He sees the haggard face behind the visor. Whiskered, spattered with dried blood. He understands.  117.

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: (in wonder) You were on Erix. What did you see? No, there’s no time. You have to run. They’1l kill you.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: They're trying.

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: They've locked you up, here. They mean to make you disappear. And there's something else.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: LARSON
dialogues.text: Ada.

dialogues.speaker: MEDICAL COMPLEX
dialogues.text: Ada lies in bed, in a hospital gown. Her head is shaven. cybernetic crown gleams against her scalp. Beside the bed hang a Master’s black coat and cap. She stares at the coa SCREAMS outside the door. Running feet. The door jumps in its frame. Ada shrinks back in her bed. powerful force tears the door open. Shadow Nineteen enters, a metal giant. She rushes to him.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Conrad! She sees the dried blood on his face, the beard. Stops sh

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: You're the Shadow. You’re Nineteen. He stares at her bald head: the crown embedded in the fle

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: What have they done to you? She makes a futile attempt to cover her head with her han

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Why did you come back?

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: To set things right. Ada. (he steps closer) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHADOW NINETEEN (cont'd) I never dreamed they’d do this. Are you all right? Tears shine in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter, does it? What’s done is done. Shadow Nineteen’s face is wracked with guilt. He looks anxiously out into the deserted medical facility.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: We can’t stay here. I’ve been welding doors shut, but the guards will come soon. I’m going to break myself out. The real me. Can you hide until I... Ada sheds her hospital gown. Puts on the black coat.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I’m going with you.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: It won't be safe.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I know where he is. And I can help you now. She places the black skullcap over her crown.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen advances down a corridor, rifle raised. One by one, security cannons take aim at them - and one b one, Shadow Nineteen blows them to shrapnel. They reach an intersection. BULLETS whine off of Shadow Nineteen’s armor: Guards approach down the crossing corri Shadow Nineteen fires back, his rifle barking. Ada GESTURES: Doors SLAM SHUT between them and the guards

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: How long can you keep that up before they revoke your privileges?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: They already have. I’m using Director Marbeck’s ID.  119.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: (grinning) Nice.

dialogues.speaker: STORAGE ROOM
dialogues.text: Red alarm lights throb. Vance paces in his bare metal cel O.S. GUNFIRE outside the door. Heavy footfalls approach. The door slides open. Ada enters.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Ada! They embrace fiercely. Troubled, Vance reaches for her bl skullcap. She shrinks away.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Don’t. Please. Listen. There’s someone outside the door. He’s going to help us.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen stands watch in the corridor. A guard lie unconscious at his feet. Ada emerges from the cell. Vance follows warily. Vance and Shadow Nineteen stand face to face, staring at other: Vance in perfect health, lightly dressed - Shadow Nineteen haggard and wounded, in armor. Vance is speechle

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Hello, Vance.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: (cautiously) Hello, Vance. What’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: I’m getting the two of you out.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: And you?

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about me. I’m not even supposed to exist. Ada looks sharply away down the hallway.  120.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Someone's opening the doors I locked. I'm sorry. I'm new at this.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Let’s head for the roof. Can you get us to your freight elevator?

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I think so. Vance crouches and takes fallen guard’s pistol.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: SERVICE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: A deserted hallway. The freight elevator door is closed. Shadow Nineteen, Ada, and Vance arrive at the elevator do Turning, Ada concentrates and closes a corridor door behi them. Ada palms the elevator switch. The floor indicator shows elevator descending from the roof. They wait.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: What happened on Erix?

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: I saw the Angel of Death. Vance and Ada stare at Shadow Nineteen, mystified.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: We fought. And I killed it. But it was just...a creature. A living thing. And then I found a city. A city of these things.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: You saw them!

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: They're terrifying. But they're -.-people. I thought Erix was Hell. But it's just somebody else's world. Ada looks at corridor door in fright.  121.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Someone's opening the door. I can't hold it. Shadow Nineteen takes aim at the door. They watch the elevator's floor indicator nervously. Suddenly a SIREN sounds. A heavy steel SECURITY GATE begi to close in front of the elevator, sealing it off. Shadow Nineteen throws himself at the descending gate and heaves. The gate stops in his tracks, its motors whining. Very rapidly: the corridor door slides open. SSA GUARDS w on the other side. Vance pulls Ada behind him. His pistol snaps up: he fires several rounds. Two guards fall. Others return fire. A BULLET slams into Vance's ribs. He SCREAMS. Shadow Nineteen, still holding off the security gate, twi in place and FIRES his laser rifle. It tears a glowing fu in the wall. The guards fall back, shouting. The elevator opens. Vance struggles in, leaning on Ada. Shadow Nineteen dives into the elevator. The security gat SLAMS down. The elevator doors close.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR SHAFT
dialogues.text: Concrete walls rush past as the freight elevator rises. S echoes in the confined space. Vance sinks to the deck.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I’m hit. Shadow Nineteen rolls Vance over. The wound is severe, a bloody puncture between the left ribs. Shadow Nineteen presses a battlefield dressing over the injury.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: It’s bad.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Vance fumbles blindly for Ada. She takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Hang on, Conrad. We’ll get help.  122. She weeps. Vance is fading fast. A shudder racks his body and a look of amazement crosses his face.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: I’m not going to make it. Shadow Nineteen leans close.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: You keep breathing. I’ve seen you dead too many times. Vance looks at Shadow Nineteen. His lips barely move.

dialogues.speaker: VANCE
dialogues.text: It’s only fair. I’m the only one who never paid a price. (weaker still) It’s all yours now. The life drains out of him.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: (urgently) Athena. Medical. ATHENA’S VOICE Medical. He places two fingertips on Vance’s chest. A muddy MURMUR He tears open the shirt. Lays his gloves on Vance’s ribs.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Clear! Ada jerks her hands back. A THUMP as voltage pours throug Vance’s body. He arches and lies still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glorious SUNSET drenches the city in light. The freight elevator rises into view and locks into place Shadow Nineteen kneels over Vance. Ada beside him. Vance isn’t breathing. Shadow Nineteen stands. He seems stunned - he can't take his eyes off his own dead body.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: What are you doing?  123.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: (hollowly) He’s gone. Ada cries, clutches at Vance. Shadow Nineteen stirs. Gent pulls her away.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Ada. He’s gone. We have to move. She looks at him, paralyzed. She’s just watched her lover die, but here he stands in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Captain Vance. They turn. Director Marbeck stares down at Vance’s body.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: You make this difficult. You dirty my hands. Shadow Nineteen aims his rifle at Marbeck.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have come alone.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: I don't need help to deal with you. He waves contemptuously at Shadow Nineteen. Shadow Ninete armor POWERS DOWN. He collapses like a marionette with cu strings. He sprawls on his back, unable to move.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Athena. Athena!

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: I had your armor modified, Captain. A precaution. I reserve myself certain privileges. I'll tolerate no more...

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Damn you! She launches herself at Marbeck in a two-handed shove tha sends him staggering. She follows, poised to shove him ag Enraged, he grapples with her . Flings her to the pavemen She strikes her head cries out. Marbeck turns back to Shadow Nineteen - but his armor lie open and empty. Shadow Nineteen steps free in his skinsui  124.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Enough. He HAMMERS Marbeck across the face with his massive rifle Marbeck staggers and cries out.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Guards! Guards! Shadow Nineteen backs Marbeck up against a pillar. His ar tremble under the weight of a rifle meant for powered arm GUARDS swarm onto the rooftop. Ada darts to Shadow Nineteen’s side. Marbeck glares at gunpoint, his mouth bleeding freely. The guards surround them in a thicket of pistols.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: If you shoot me, they’11l kill you. Lay down the gun and live.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: You won't let us live. We know what you've done. Marbeck glances at Shadow Nineteen’s trembling arms.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: How long can you bear that weight? O.S. A RUMBLE.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: (grinning in triumph) Long enough. A shadow falls over them all.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Stand down! A MARINE AIRSHIP hovers over the rooftop. Six ARMORED MARINES leap from the airship on jump-jets. T encircle Marbeck and his guards, rifles raised. The SSA Guards, so menacing a moment ago, suddenly look l children. They drop their weapons. Exhausted, Shadow Nineteen lays his massive rifle down.  125.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: You're trespassing! This is a secure facility! You have no right! The Marines' PLATOON LEADER steps forward. He scans the rooftop: takes in Vance's body; the battered armor lying open; Shadow Nineteen in his military skinsuit.

dialogues.speaker: PLATOON LEADER
dialogues.text: There's a Marine distress beacon coming from this rooftop, sir. I'm required to respond. (to Shadow Nineteen) Do you need assistance, sir?

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Yes. Captain Conrad Vance, Third Offworld Division. I need evac right now. Me, this woman, and... (he hesitates, looking at Vance lying dead) ...that Marine.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: These people are in my custody!

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: (to Marbeck) Not any more. (to the Platoon Leader) Call the police. Get them here. And call the office of the Secretary of Defense. Tell them Conrad Vance has a story to tell.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Let's get airborne. Too many surprises here. The Marines collect Vance’s body, the crippled armor. Sha Nineteen pulls Ada toward the airship.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: (to Ada, desperately) Scientist. You are not released! Ada shoots him a cold look. Moves closer to Shadow Ninete Marbeck is unravelling, almost snarling.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR MARBECK
dialogues.text: Captain! Remember your writ of secrecy!  126.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: You killed the man who signed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadow Nineteen and Ada sit huddled against a bulkhead. Armored Marines sit around them. Outside, the skyscrapers of New Washington slide by. Shadow Nineteen and Ada cling to each other, their eyes haunted. He lifts a finger. Traces the line of her crown.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: I know I’m not what I used to be. He pulls her closer.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: Neither am I.

dialogues.speaker: ADA
dialogues.text: Don’t think about it now. For now let’s just be. You’re Conrad Vance. You came home. He stares across a vast distance. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: I’m still there. Ada looks at him, questioning.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW NINETEEN
dialogues.text: You can’t come home. You can only send your shadow home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lurid sky bathes Prometheus in red light. The door opens. An armored Marine, his armor blackened by fire, looks out in despair at the jungles of Erix. The ID plate on his armor reads VANCE 19. Predators slink from the undergrowth at the sound of the door, watching him, circling. FADE OUT.
